Review.Titre: 30 day free trial, SCAM
Review.Contenu: Signed up for a 30 day free trial, but woke up the next day to find out I had been charged for a month of the service. My bank account is now overdrawn thanks to this scam of a business.EDIT: Called customer service and was promised that the billing department would call me back that afternoon. I haven’t heard from them at all. The customer service agent said that it was probably just a 24hr authorization hold and would go away, but it’s been over 48hr and it’s still there. Do not trust this company.

Review.Titre: Identity Force NOT worth the money
Review.Contenu: I found out my phone number was on the dark net through another protection service. We were getting calls and texts regarding this breech. When I called IF I was told they did not catch this and could not tell me why. Will not renew this service, going with a reliable co.

Review.Titre: Please beware
Review.Contenu: Please beware, you are billed yearly and the service is difficult to cancel with this company. I did not want to renew as I subscribe to identity monitoring under a different company. You are not provided FICO scores but Vantage scores which lenders do not use. A representative called me and I told them I did not want to renew but 2 weeks later and I got charged. This plan is active until the "next billing cycle" which is yearly.

Review.Titre: Not impressed with this company.
Review.Contenu: Not impressed with this company. The customer service individuals you speak to are useless, and have little knowledge of how to resolve your issues with canned responses. Took 6 months to be notified of an email breach. However receive weekly notices about sex offenders in our area, which by the way are of public record on our local sheriff's website free of charge. Our credit reporting information says it is updated monthly and has yet to be updated in the last 8 months. Not a company I feel confident in to protect my identity.

Review.Titre: Identity stolen 3 times with IdentifyForce coverage.
Review.Contenu: My identity was stolen 3 times during the time I had IndentityForce coverage and IdentityForce never alerted me to any of them.  I also had all of my accounts set to alert me to any purchases over $200 and any time my credit was pulled.  I was rarely alerted to any purchases over $200.  I made multiple large purchases over $1000 which IdentityForce never caught.  I even took out a loan for $22,000 which IdentityForce didn't catch until 5 weeks later.  I'm confident that this service is one of the worst available as they have proven that they are not actively motoring anything.   Spend your money elsewhere.

Review.Titre: I tried to cancel a reoccurring…
Review.Contenu: I tried to cancel a reoccurring subscription. It was basically impossible to do so per the agents I spoke with. I had to file a dispute with my credit card company. One agent's suggestion was that I cancel my card so they would stop billing me. Multiple agents were unhelpful or condescending and the manager was always out of the office or at lunch when I asked for her.

Review.Titre: You get what you pay for
Review.Contenu: I have had no information or help in working with this product. Since it’s a free resource, having had a recent security breach, I guess I shouldn’t complain. But the adage “You get what you pay for” is true.

Review.Titre: Had Identity Force less than a year…
Review.Contenu: Had Identity Force less than a year and cancelled.  Customer service is suspect.  They say they’ll check into trouble and contact you back, but after 4 calls to customer service they did not cure the problem and NEVER received a callback.FYI:  It you use any other browser than Chrome or MS Edge, you may have trouble.  I use Safari or Brave for my secure browser and I was told that there product does not work with either of those browsers.  I couldn't get transaction monitoring for the last 4 months and was unable to add accounts.  I paid for what?No refund offered and would never recommend this company, in fact, they cancelled my account after telling me that I would have to cancel it.Go somewhere else for protection.

Review.Titre: Very poor performance
Review.Contenu: It's June 15th, 2022, and I haven't had a single alert from IdentityForce since October of 2021 although I keep receiving constant reminders of seminars from them. I have their best plan however, I've had three attempts by unknown individuals trying to open credit cards in my name this year alone. I don't need seminars, what I need is protection and I'm not getting it. They are very efficient in charging my credit card on time, however, They really have no effect when it comes to protecting my identity. I canceled my membership today however, they refused to refund the bulk of my payment. The customer service rep told me when I called that she would refer me to a specialist that would call me within the hour. That was four hours ago and still no call. I am filing a complaint with the Better Business Bureau and a fraud case with the credit card company. Be aware that this company is excellent at taking your money and not much else.

Review.Titre: I canceled this membership
Review.Contenu: I canceled this membership, well at least I thought I did but they are still taking money monthly

Review.Titre: very poor service
Review.Contenu: I sent a message on Fri, Sep 23 at 11:56 AM & I didn't get a response.    That is why I rate it horrible.

Review.Titre: 3 Days and I had to Cancel
Review.Contenu: On Friday, 9/10 I bought the Indentity Force Credit Secure Plus for my family.  I received the activation email and when I tried to set up my account it failed.  I called Identity Force for technical support and all I was told is that there is no support available and they would put in a ticket.  Being rather upset that an online company had no technical support and that I had to wait for a call 30 minutes after purchasing the product I called to cancel.  The customer service rep could only create a ticket.  So less than 3 hours after purchasing a service that I could not access or get support for I had to wait for my refund to be processed by a separate rep.  On Sunday, 9/12 I got a call from a very nice young lady, who tried to help me get logged in.  The first time it failed and with no support the best she could do is cancel and try to create a new account.  We tried again for the second time to log in and it failed.  The best this young lady could offer was to either open a ticket for tech support or cancel.  I chose to cancel.  She told me a platform migration was happening and that glitches were occurring, which I understand.  However, to have no technical support for your product during a migration and known issues is mind numbing and just horrible for the customer and the rep.  Shame on this company for the way they run an online system and the fact there is zero technical support beyond waiting for a call.  I know nothing will change, but if I can't get through the basic account activation, what makes me think you can protect my family and I along with our data.9/14 - As you see by the response from Identity Force, they admit they are openly overwhelmed and the a world class experience is just buzz word.  What would my coming back do if I can't get logged in or technical support is overwhelmed.  I see nothing here to make me want to return as you've offered nothing other than excuses.

Review.Titre: Don't expect quick resolution assistance
Review.Contenu: I was a multi-year subscriber to IdentityForce service, and was satisfied with its monitoring and reporting.  While reporting is useful, the primary reason for having the service was to get a rapid response and assistance to understand and resolve a breach or other security-related issue. That type of support tops every other product benefit, because there's no point being alerted to a credit-related or identity-related problem if assistance is not readily available.  Thus the low score.When I called to follow up on an alert about my primary credit card, the agent told me she would send the matter to someone who would respond by phone within 24 to 48 hours.I was shocked that I had to await a phone call for as long as 2 days for details about the problem and how to resolve it, so I made certain I understood what she was saying.  When that process was confirmed, I asked to speak to a supervisor or directed to another phone number.  She said the number I had dialed was the only process available, my only option was to wait for a call.That same day I enrolled in an another identity monitoring service.If you expect to receive prompt assistance for an identity-related problem I recommend searching for a company that actually cares as much about assisting its customers, as it does touting its services in its advertising.  After enrolling I have called my new service numerous times for assistance.   Each time, their 800 number has been answered immediately or within 2 minutes, with US-based agents who are extremely helpful and courteous. I waited awhile to post this review because I didn't want to overreact. I'm doing it because I think the issue is important enough to share my experience with others.

Review.Titre: I signed up with Identity Force a…
Review.Contenu: I signed up with Identity Force a couple of weeks ago, so far it has been pure frustration I was adding accounts into my identity vault I could not add 2 accounts even though that were in their database, I called I was informed that in 24 hours that a tech specialist would give me a call to fix the problem, I received a call the next day from a employee the same level has the previous employee I explained to her I was informed you were going to be a tech to fix the problem more frustration she was going to escalate this to her supervisor. it has been over two weeks and the problem is still not fixed I am paying for a service I can not fully utilize. instead of going to one place for all my transactions I have to go to 3 different places for all my transactions I am wasting my money at this point extremely  disappointed with this ccompany.

Review.Titre: Received notification of new inquiry
Review.Contenu: Received notification of new inquiry.  Went to my dashboard, received authentication code which I used, but when Alerts page listed I was unable to access details.  Continued to receive bar notice at the bottom "To access your credit services, you must complete authentication" - which I had already done.  The "Alert" box continues to show circling shape for over 5 minutes and nothing.  Frustrating experience.

Review.Titre: This company is a fraud
Review.Contenu: This company is a fraud. They say they're looking for fraud but they don't do it it's just your identity they are not there to protect you or let you know or help you out if someone grabs your credit card or your data. Beware be very very aware.  If you call customer service you're going to be on the phone for an hour and a callback to be hours after that if you leave your number.

Review.Titre: Can't Cancel!
Review.Contenu: Same problem as everyone else! I can't cancel my membership! Signed up under the free trial, but this is shady. I understand there's a breach, but if you don't have the customer support staff to be able to sufficiently support your product, you won't last as a business. I've emailed, called, been on hold, tried the call back option, and I've gotten nothing. This is a joke.

Review.Titre: No one answers the phone
Review.Contenu: No one answers the phone, even after holding for over an hour.  No one calls back if you press #1 or if you press # 2 to cancel the service.  I have emailed, but am unsure as to whether the service will be canceled due to the lack of (or non-existent) customer service.Idenity Force  has sent me numerous notifications and has my email address from the email I sent to them so they should have a record of me.

Review.Titre: After signing up
Review.Contenu: After signing up, I was tricked as a added family and updating personal information, they hit me with a double fee where other companies only charge additional $10, these guys doubled up and have no means of canceling at allIn followup, answer below is not correct and nothing was done to satisfy me. It's a typical response. If they really care, they would post upfront single and family prices.  So watch out.

Review.Titre: 1 . Dismal
Review.Contenu: 1. Your alerts are not explicit- I have to call support to figure out what the alerts mean and then they can't answer my questions. 2. Why on earth would I give you my log-in to my credit card, banking, and mortgage companies? I am already a victim of id theft!!!!  I give this information to no one.  Should you not just ask for the account numbers?

Review.Titre: Do not subscribe
Review.Contenu: Initially, I was impressed with the service only to learn that I am NOT receiving my FICO scores on a quarterly basis but some OTHER calculation that leaves me exposed to being denied credit and armed with garbage when I go about pursuing rental properties. Not a few points but nearly 100 point variance is not remotely acceptable. Would never renew or endorse IdentityForce

Review.Titre: I have sent numerous emails and called …
Review.Contenu: I have sent numerous emails and called numerous times being forced to leave a call back number but never receiving a return call. CANCEL MY ACCOUNT. My credit card should not be charged as I am still within the free trial period. I will be putting a hold on my card against Identity Force and if you try to charge my card I will submit a BBB claim. AGAIN, CANCEL MY ACCOUNT AND SEND A CONFIRMATION TO MY EMAIL THAT IT HAS BEEN CANCELLED.

Review.Titre: The simulator is extremely faulty and …
Review.Contenu: The simulator is extremely faulty and not giving good results especially when you pick a combination of things. I put in declare bankruptcy along with several other items and the score didn't even drop at all. This is quite a disappointment as I have used other simulators from similar sites that worked reasonably well. Not sure if I can continue to use this site because this one of the reasons I signed up for an account.

Review.Titre: Sorry to see you are shooting yourself …
Review.Contenu: Sorry to see you are shooting yourself in the foot with eliminating members ability to obtain their monthly credit score.  Every 3 months doesn't get it done for me so I will not be renewing my account when it terminates.  Have already cancelled the auto renewal.  Bad timing on your part when most credit card companies now offer a gratis credit score.  Hope your decision costs you lots of customers and you go out of business.

Review.Titre: When I originally started this service …
Review.Contenu: When I originally started this service I added many cards I had and now they are no longer showing up on here..  To add an account is very difficult and I have not been successful in any attempt.  When I get an alert from you it is about 5 days after the transaction.  What good is that??I am seriously considering cancelling and finding another company.

Review.Titre: The sign up was very deceptive
Review.Contenu: The sign up was very deceptive. I was able to add my spouse so it seemed as if the price for both of us was $200 a year but then when I entered the account it seemed as if his name had never been added and then it was updating the change to $400. Just be upfront with the cost so I can make an informed decision. I am planning on cancelling my account today.

Review.Titre: I have been a member for about 2 hours
Review.Contenu: I have been a member for about 2 hours.  I signed up and couldn't get the verification to work for my credit reports.  I have no problem verifying my credit reports w/ the credit bureau, but Identity Force rejected my verification.  I've been on hold for 1 hour and 20 minutes trying to talk to someone.  Very disappointed and frustrated.

Review.Titre: No help. No return call from support.
Review.Contenu: Had a tech hack to my computer.  Exposed credit cards and other data. Called Identity Force for help. Told they were very concerned but needed someone higher up involved. I was told I’d get a call back within 24 hrs. Never got a call back or any help whatsoever. Had to handle by myself. This is why I got the policy. Will cancel ASAP.

Review.Titre: You all are fast convincing me that I…
Review.Contenu: You all are fast convincing me that I should cancel my membership!  I have called several times and each time, have been put on hold for longer than when I called the IRS, which is saying something  --- BAD!Come on, guys, what is the use of my paying all this money to you when I cannot get any kind of help or info. from you all!

Review.Titre: Customer Service is Rude....
Review.Contenu: Not good at all....and when you trying to question/explain something pertaining to your package, the customer service reps are RUDE and try to over talk you(the customer) just to prove they're right and you're wrong, making it difficult to even finish a sentence. So I just cancelled my subscription because I can not deal with rudeness.

Review.Titre: Very confusing and unhelpful website
Review.Contenu: No consistency between the alert situation of equifax. Your website says my profile is not complete and directs me to activate the fraud alert function, but equifax says I already have fraud alert function. You're sending text message and email to notify about fraud alert, but there is no any explanation about it.  Contact is not available during the weekend.

Review.Titre: I have emailed 2x and called 2x
Review.Contenu: I have emailed 2x and called 3x. I have left my number for a call back and maintain my place in the air: however that was a week ago and still haven’t received a call back. Currently on hold for the third time which is going on 20 min (yes I know a higher call volume, but my place in que cannot he still waiting a week later). How am I to trust they will handle a problem if I can get a hold of them. At this point I’m going to cancel if I can ever get someone on the phone.

Review.Titre: Horrible experience
Review.Contenu: Horrible experience.  I signed up and paid $189.50.  Went through the hoops to register and get a password.  Tried to log in with password and couldn't; was sent an email to get a new password, which didn't work either.  Called 3 times.  Two times the wait was so long I couldn't hold.  The 3rd time I opted for them to call me back.  They never did.  Since I can't reach them in any way, I feel paralyzed.I want my money refunded immediately and to terminate with this company.

Review.Titre: star provided for 30 day trial option …
Review.Contenu: star provided for 30 day trial option only.no inhouse ticket systemno opt out options at first sightunable to get through via phone 9.6.2017lots of available services but without opt out they can peddle your info to the highest bidderkudo their sms services can process 21th century voip services, no go via lifelock or identity guardunable to turn off dopple login verification, keep in mind this can profile you via gpsmay consider continuance but not without opt out option

Review.Titre: Constant alerts and customer service sucks
Review.Contenu: I signed yup for a trail and canceled within a week. They sent constant alerts which were either vague and gave no  information, or were nothing at all. They send the alert in a language that scares the crap out of you, maybe that is part of their game.  I called costumer support I got an attitude. Also the fraud alert they say you can activate on your file is also untrue. I had not problem opening accounts after supposedly placing a fraud alert. Life lock is much better

Review.Titre: Doesn't Notify of Changes
Review.Contenu: Someone else's credit got merged on my credit report in the last couple days. Because the accounts were opened years ago, Identity Force doesn't consider these 'new' so they didn't notify me. There is obviously some limitations in their system. I should be alerted to ANY change in my credit.

Review.Titre: Confusing and frustrating
Review.Contenu: I went through the "delete now" steps but see no confirmation that anything was deleted.During the initial setup, I erroneously scanned my photo ID incorrectly, but after emails and phone calls, I still have not been told how to rescan it. It seems like after the initial setup there is little or no followup.

Review.Titre: You don't pay real attention
Review.Contenu: I'm already sick of getting too many meaningless alerts.  There was an attempt to make a purchase at Macy's, where my account has been 2 times comprimised, and it was Macy's that alerted me, not you.  Disgusted is the simple term.  I know what bills I get and when I pay them: that's banking, and I don't need alerting for that.  When someone impresonates me, I do need that alert and that's the 1 thing you haven't done.  I was alerted Saturday 2/25 at 11:30 am PST.  You should do better

Review.Titre: Expensive service little value
Review.Contenu: Expensive service, very little value add over and above anything Credit Karla does for free including your credit scores. Get yourself some basic identity theft monitoring from someone else not looking to charge you $180 per year. Alo not possible to cancel online meaning a long hold with a rep.

Review.Titre: DELAYED Notifications
Review.Contenu: I am not impressed with the response time of their notifications. I made a $2200 purchase on a credit card and the notification was sent to me days later. My bank does a better job than that.I sent a message to customer support about my concern and did not get a response.If you purchase a one year plan, there are not any refunds and you can only change your credit card, not remove it off of the account. They auto bill  your card when it is time to renew.I recommend another service that offers refunds for time not used.

Review.Titre: DOES NOT USE SAFARI. WASTED $239 in minutes!
Review.Contenu: Had no idea we couldn't use our Safari browser with this program. We don't want to use any other browsers. WE should have been told this BEFORE we had to pay! Just wasted $239 and I am not happy about it.Need to start writing reviews online so this doesn't happen top anyone else.

Review.Titre: Needed to talk to an agent - waited forever with no success
Review.Contenu: Needed to talk to an agent, was waiting in que for 15 min, than opted for the call back offer. Never got a call back. This was Saturday, March 24, 2018.Tried again the following day..same thing.maybe there is only one agent on a weekend?Good thing I like to listen to classical music.

Review.Titre: I signed up and it says to go manage my…
Review.Contenu: I signed up and it says to go manage my alerts but no where in the site does it say how to do that??? Not sure if I paid $400.00 for nothing??? Also, had to call customer service because the web-site was giving error message. Not a real confidence booster for a protection site.

Review.Titre: I have accidentally inputted the wrong …
Review.Contenu: I have accidentally inputted the wrong ss# and you have given me information about whoever that person is... and not myself. I can't change it on-line. I can't change it when I signed up and realized the mistake. I have to call. You charged me anyway, My wife did not complete her registration and you charged her anyway. For a company who is supposed to be protecting people - it seems your platform actually puts people at risk. The wrongly inputted social security number does not match my name in the slightest and yet I have this woman's info now.

Review.Titre: I'm a new customer and your website has …
Review.Contenu: I'm a new customer and your website has many problems and doesn't work right. unacceptable. I can't set up the financial transaction monitoring. or the "delete now" identity protection. give me a break. What good is your service if your website is bunk?

Review.Titre: Rating is for initial setup,  IDK how the system itself runs, I assume much better…
Review.Contenu: I have only experienced initial account set-up and this rating relates to that experience only.  The system needs cookies on and ad blocking off when using Chrome browser.  Nothing is said about these settings in the online documentation (at least that I could find after hours of looking when tech support was not available).  You cannot get the system to allow you to complete your profile without having several (3) settings correctly set in your browser preferences. I have spent 4 hours with technical support, 1 or more hours on my own and the problem was not solved.

Review.Titre: Can't find a way to cancel service on …
Review.Contenu: Can't find a way to cancel service on the website, though it's easy to find the upgrade button.  They don't respond to e-mail to their customer service center, and they have a long wait in the phone queue.  Still waiting for a call back to put in a cancel order.

Review.Titre: The wait time to reach a live person is …
Review.Contenu: The wait time to reach a live person is unreasonably long.  I would like to manage my protection in a manner that is not so disruptive to my life.  Currently, I receive notices daily which just adds to my stress.  None of those notices warrant my attention.  As an example, I received a notice that my cell phone was posted on usphonebook.com .  I obviously do not want to receive solicitation calls but there was no remedy.  Just a 'thought you'd like to know."  Simple advice:  If you don't have a solution, I don't want to know about the problem.

Review.Titre: I just signed my son (24 years) up for …
Review.Contenu: I just signed my son (24 years) up for this security program. He has had fraudulent activity on his USAA checking account and CEFCU credit card. I waiting on the phone for over one hour to report CEFCU credit card fraudulent activity and representative said, "someone will get back to you within 24 hours). There are NO helpful services for ID theft online that a person could help themselves. Please call (309) 369-1606 Julie Ann Driscoll mother of Anthony M Driscoll. I bought a year with one or two months free; but I think we will cancel this service as it has been NO HELP>

Review.Titre: I have been trying for days to get …
Review.Contenu: I have been trying for days to get support to add accounts.  The website isn't working property.  I can't get any assistance.  I have called and emailed.  We are only in our first year and not happy with this.  Never had poor service like this at Lifelock.

Review.Titre: Your service stinks
Review.Contenu: I signed up recently for your service and entered my husband's information assuming I would at some point enter my info as his spouse.  When I called your office toda , I was told that was not the case and I would have to purchase a membership in my name to accomplish this. Our accounts are all joint accounts and it would stand to reason that we would want protection for both of us. It is my intention to cancel our account as soon as my husband is available.  I am very disappointed that this is not clearly indicated on your home page when one signs up. Corrine Jung.

Review.Titre: Bad service
Review.Contenu: I have been trying to activate what were previously active services (phone, bank account, email monitoring) but system won't let me. Notwithstanding the fact that i can't determine  how long my services have been inactive, I am paying for services that I am not getting.   I've called Identity Force 3 times and have a ticket number for tech support but still no resolution. I am on the phone (on hold)  with Identity Force right at this moment to get an update on what the problem is, and a solution.  Absent resolution I will cancel my service before my next billing cycle.

Review.Titre: Very disappointed
Review.Contenu: Very disappointed. Identity Force has not responded to multiple emails sent to them. If things do not improve in the next 30 days, I'm just going to cancel (even though I will lose my money).I'm going to take a look again at their competitors.

Review.Titre: When I click on the link in the Welcome…
Review.Contenu: When I click on the link in the Welcome email and try to fill out the information form, it won't let me choose Arizona or enter Arizona in the address field or the Drivers License state fields. So it won't let me complete the form to submit!

Review.Titre: Monthly, low-threat nuisance alerts
Review.Contenu: Stop sending me the same, low-threat alert every month about e-mail and phone number.  Do try to let me know what to do about things like the Equifax breach in a timely mannerReply 9/25:>  To avoid receiving alerts regarding email address and phone numbers you may go into the email address monitoring and phone number monitoring to remove the information if you no longer wish to receive alerts regarding this information.But I do want to receive e-mail and phone number alerts.  That's why I subscribe to IF services.  I should be able to set a threshold since you are assigning threat values already.

Review.Titre: This is a scam
Review.Contenu: I am ready to cancel my account because I cannot get through to speak with them. What good does it do to have the protection if you can't get through to talk to anyone?  Seems like a scam to me, they take your money and that's the end of it.

Review.Titre: There is a very serious flaw in your …
Review.Contenu: There is a very serious flaw in your mail fraud monitor with regard to change of address.  I paid for a service to alert me to mail fraud and you missed it.  Not worth the service and I will share with everyone I know.Sadly,Sad Customer.....

Review.Titre: I had my wallet stolen,
Review.Contenu: I had my wallet stolen,Have been on hold for nearly 30 minutes & cannot find another # or way to contact you...  Not good to have this happen in time of need...If I do not get help soon I will cancel this service...Please call me ASAP

Review.Titre: I called for initial information and …
Review.Contenu: I called for initial information and the phone was answered right away by a lady who explained how service oriented the company is, based on that call I purchased the product for me and my wife. On signing up I had some questions. I was put on hold and then placed on a call back wait list (2X). It has been over 24 hours with no call back from either attempt. This morning I called the same line I did for initial information and explained I could not get any assistance and was given a 866 #. I did get a person who was rude and condescending. So far not very impressed with the service as none of my questions were answered.

Review.Titre: Lousy response service
Review.Contenu: Lousy response service, long hold  time at 1100 minutes + wait time   , numerous calls but unable  to get hold of any one , and no return call after leaving message. not much help provided by customer staff on registration process .

Review.Titre: Seems like IdentityForce is very much …
Review.Contenu: Seems like IdentityForce is very much understaff.  Each call to customer service is extremely long wait and no call has been returned even I chose to have call return.  Not happy at all with ur customer support when customer needed.

Review.Titre: For the money spent you may want to …
Review.Contenu: For the money spent you may want to look into having your website upgraded.  When making changes it state Missing Arguments.  Whatever the hell that means.  Cookie do not need to be enabled, there is no reason to track my moves.

Review.Titre: You have the worst website I have…
Review.Contenu: You have the worst website I have encountered on the Internet in 20 years....It's not functional except for taking payments....you've got broken input code, data scripts, who designed this website..A three year old?

Review.Titre: I pointed out that you had issues with…
Review.Contenu: I pointed out that you had issues with the link to your downloadable software for PC's.  I then let you know that I was able to get a copy from another computer and it ran correctly.  I then received a message, not thanking me for helping you troubleshoot your new system, but asking how I was able to install another copy since I only get one for each subscription.  My wife and I pay $400 per year for your service, and I was installing the second license.  For that kind of money your service should work, and you should treat your customers better and not send insulting comments.  I will have to evaluate whether to keep your service or not, especially how you treat your customers.

Review.Titre: Hate the new website
Review.Contenu: Hate the new website, much of the functionality doesn't work. Can't update my credit card for billing and I get errors on the dashboard about credit card not found. Please can we have the previous site back.

Review.Titre: Late response to alerts, no search on your site, no information on your site to cancel my account.
Review.Contenu: Late response to alerts, no search on your site. I called member services at 4:30pm on 6/22/17 EST and opted for a call back and am still waiting (time is 8:22pm EST). No information on your site to cancel my account.

Review.Titre: I have a Mac and just signed up for …
Review.Contenu: I have a Mac and just signed up for your $199/yr service only to find out your software is incompatible with Mac's Safari.  It's not 1999, so I expected far much better interoperability given the price point.

Review.Titre: Slow, clunky and unable to cancel account.
Review.Contenu: Slow, clunky and unable to cancel account.Has not been a great experience and as other reviewers have noted, there is no area on the site that allows you to CANCEL your account.  Switching to another service today.

Review.Titre: This is a terrible new site
Review.Contenu: This is a terrible new site. The older one was simple everything; was on a single screen. I have been on this twice and cannot figure out where to renew my fraud alert. This new dashboard is not at all intuitive.

Review.Titre: I signed up two weeks ago and still …
Review.Contenu: I signed up two weeks ago and still cant set up to see my credit score, eve-though I paid for ultrasecure +credit. I tried calling many times but could not go through to speak to someone. I even left my number and still didn't get a call. I emailed several times; however, finally I received an email telling me that I should go to Credit Services from My dashboard and I will get a pop up ...Well, there is no Credit Services from Dashboard, at least not on my screen. There is no web based Technical based answers on your website, only about identity theft and what to do if ....., but nothing about how to set up and or navigate your website.Anyways, I'm very much frustrated and disappointed.

Review.Titre: Terrible customer service
Review.Contenu: I tried out for the free 14 day trial and within 6 days I was charged $129.00 on my credit card. I don't want this service at all and have been on hold for over an hour trying to reach them to cancel it.

Review.Titre: All take, no give?!
Review.Contenu: So far,I gave this program all of the information and it has given me NONE!Does it tell me anything that I don't provide??  What am I missing?  I'm ready to cancel! waste of my time and money!

Review.Titre: I enrolled for a 30 day trial and my …
Review.Contenu: I enrolled for a 30 day trial and my credit card was immediately charged for the full amount rather than the normal $1.  I then tried to fill out all necessary requirements to activate my account and being on an Apple device would require me to download a different browser, which I will not do.  Called to cancel and waited for 45 minutes then opted for the call back and they never called back.  This morning I waited on for 95 minutes and gave up.  Still waiting for that call back.  Cannot find a way to cancel on their site.Update 9/29: IdentityForce never did call back but I finally got through with days of persistence whenever I had the spare time.  And what a waste of my time it was!  I would never recommend this company.

Review.Titre: sign up over the weekend
Review.Contenu: sign up over the weekend, decided to cancel on the 1st day, customer services not open, call on tuesday because of long weekend. Still needed to charge me for the home month me and my wife. ridiculous.

Review.Titre: Identity Force crazy bad
Review.Contenu: I just called (as told by their site) to "verify" I am who I say. BUT the only way to do that is to send a photo ID. Even though they confirm cancellation by sending me an email, and even though I am calling from the acct phone number, even though they are prorating the credit card I signed up with, they won't believe who I am without me mailing a copy of a photo ID. The Woman on the phone was loud and close to rude, refused to allow me to speak to anyone else because it is POLICY peroid. The site is pretty worthless, scare tactics, lists dead sex offenders etc. Tells you how many millions of people are victims but then do something stupid like this. Gee, you can't call my home or cell to verify who I am ?

Review.Titre: So far I’m not real impressed
Review.Contenu: So far I’m not real impressed. I called regarding an alert with questions and the person I spoke to was unable to answer any questions. I’m wondering if I’ve chosen the right company to protect me?

Review.Titre: Difficult
Review.Contenu: I am a senior citizen trying to navigate registration. Your site is extremely difficult to use.  Evidently, there's also no Customer service on Sundays to ask for assistance.  Very disappointed!

Review.Titre: Credit Card Opening
Review.Contenu: A new credit card in my name was opened two weeks ago and Identity Force never notified me about it. Very disappointed in the service.  I had lifelock in the past and they would notify me right away.

Review.Titre: Called in for help twice and both times …
Review.Contenu: Called in for help twice and both times it was like going into the Twilight Zone. Your people were unprepared for my questions and when I was finally able to ascertain level of service cancelled.

Review.Titre: i find the website almost impossible to …
Review.Contenu: i find the website almost impossible to use.  it makes me questionthe credibility of your product.  i have spend over an hour already and still don't have it done.  i an ready to cancel.

Review.Titre: If this had been a credit breach it would have been too late to do anything as this event took place over 2 months ago.
Review.Contenu: The reason to pay for this service is to keep from having unauthorized access.  If this had been a breach it would have been too late as this took over 2 months to be brought to our attention.

Review.Titre: Big mistake!
Review.Contenu: I am so sorry I signed up for this service.  I had so much trouble with the website.  It kept getting the names mixed up.  Every time I tried to fix the registration info I got a new text with an authorization code.   Every time I responded to the texts I got charged $199.  I currently have $597 pending charges on my credit card.  I can't get in touch with anyone at this company. I've left 2 messages, sent an email and held for hours.  I've been on the phone with my credit card company and they say I have to wait until the charges get posted then I have to go through the dispute process.  What a nightmare!!! If this company can't even do the registration process right I certainly don't want them handling my identity theft.  Fingers crossed I get my money back.

Review.Titre: I want cancel your service immediately
Review.Contenu: I want cancel your service immediately. Your new website terrible and customer service terrible too. Impossible to contact. Please send me detailed instructions.Vickie Stark.

Review.Titre: I have a question about an alert I have …
Review.Contenu: I have a question about an alert I have received and cannot talk to anyone.  Message system said wait time would be 794 minutes!  Left message to get a call back, but nothing.

Review.Titre: Unable to reach service
Review.Contenu: I have been unable to get a call back from Identity Force.  When I need help, especially with identity concerns, I don't want to wait 2 days or more for service.

Review.Titre: I have been holding for customer …
Review.Contenu: I have been holding for customer support for 40 minutes!  What kind of customer service is this?  Not acceptable and I will voice same when someone finally answers!

Review.Titre: I couldn't even select my state from…
Review.Contenu: I couldn't even select my state from the drop down after several frustrating attempts. It is now not allowing me to select my security question. VERY GLITGHY.

Review.Titre: I thought i was purchasing something…
Review.Contenu: I thought i was purchasing something advanced. Wanted to know if anybody had used my name to get a loan, cell phones, etc. Nothing. its a waste of time and money

Review.Titre: A lot of work for nothing
Review.Contenu: Fill all this crap out then nothing, they asked my whole life history and still was not enough info!!! Just Another bait and switch scam will cancel right away.

Review.Titre: Unable to access credit reports/scores/monitoring
Review.Contenu: Signed up for credit report/monitoring service on 1/23/16 and was unable to access any credit information. Spoke with Dion in member services on 2/12/16 and asked for a refund since I have been unable to utilize services. He refused to issue refund stating that I had other services available to me (although I never utilized them), and he didn't have the authority to issue a refund. I asked him to cancel service effective TODAY and he stated I would get conf. of cancellation in my email at the end of the call. Also, stated he would have his supervisor, Wendy, contact me on Mon, 2/15/16, regarding the refund.  Dion was very ROBOTIC and unfriendly. He was very rude and spoke as I spoke. He was very defensive and did NOT offer any other solution. I AM A FINANCIAL CONSULTANT WHO REFERS OTHERS TO COMPANIES LIKE THIS ON A DAILY BASIS. HOWEVER, I WILL NEVER USE OR REFER THIS COMPANY AGAIN!!!

Review.Titre: I've been calling customer support for …
Review.Contenu: I've been calling customer support for the past 24 hours. No on picks up phone. I even used the call back option. No one has called since yesterday.

Review.Titre: The system does not allow me to …
Review.Contenu: The system does not allow me to activate fraud monitoring on bank cards.  Disable pop-ups and have tried everything.  Probably switching to life lock.

Review.Titre: i've tried several times to set up my…
Review.Contenu: i've tried several times to set up my profile and it has not allowed me to finish. i have tried 3 different browsers, each with different issues.

Review.Titre: Fraud Alert brings me to an OOPs page.
Review.Contenu: I know you have increased traffic, but maybe a better FAQ for problems setting up Fraud Alert and/or freeze.  Fraud Alert brings me to an OOPs page.

Review.Titre: The issue is 3 items.
Review.Contenu: The issue is 3 items.1. System cannot grab account balances off of listed accounts. Take Wells Fargo as an example, One login has immediate access to 3 accounts. The system pulls the balance for 2 of the 3. See attachments.2. The system does not pull account balance for 8 of the 18 account 'monitored'. These accounts were all logged into and 'verified' by identity force  and some work fine on the daily transaction pull.3. The system does not pull daily transactions on the Bank and Credit Card Activity report. I am sure all these issues are related.I also would a credit of free month(s) in my account equally the amount of time it takes you to correct the issues. At this point I believe you might have a good system, but not being able to pull the transaction and balance info on my accounts is starting to make me doubt / trust that I am being protected. I mean after all, my  Quicken program pulls this info flawlessly.

Review.Titre: Cancel my account
Review.Contenu: purchased with groupon that didn't apply. No customer service tab, Click save and it doesn't tried several times. Cancel my account now

Review.Titre: CANT CANCEL SERVICE!!!
Review.Contenu: I have been trying to call since MONDAY!!!!! I have now been on hold for an accumulated total of over 4 hours. I have emailed TWICE. I have not been able to reach anyone nor has anyone replied to my emailS!!! I understand being busy but, as a professional and legitimate company, that is NOT an excuse. I am going to have to report my card stolen and report this company to the BBB in order to get them to cancel this service. How is that okay? I am going to leave this review on every possible review site to make sure people know what they are getting themselves into. I had plans of signing back up after my financial crisis was over. Not anymore!!!!!****UPDATE- STILL on hold!! 1 hour and 17 minutes added to that wait time.Been holding now for 2 hours and 35 minutes! Just called my CC company and had them cancel my card. After 3 days of holding and emailing and not getting any response in return, I was left with no other options!!!!! Reporting to the BBB.

Review.Titre: I am a new member and have been waiting …
Review.Contenu: I am a new member and have been waiting on hold for 20 minutes.....I am probably going to cancel my account.  You need to hire more people

Review.Titre: The website is very unfriendly
Review.Contenu: The website is very unfriendly, all of the double verification don't work - I don't have time to be calling into fix their problem

Review.Titre: Completely TERRIBLE service !!!
Review.Contenu: Emailed questions to support on first day, took over 4 DAYS to get a reply !Offered a 30 day free trial, $199.50 annually thereafter. NO 30 day free trial as they bill you the entire amount immediately. Called customer service to question this and have been on hold for almost 4 HOURS !!! Then they simply disconnected the call !!!!NO OPTION TO CANCEL MEMBERSHIP ONLINE !! and if you don't get through within the "free trial period" THEY DO NOT REFUND ANYTHING9-25-2017Wendy, I was misled by the advertisement of the free trial (google) that you apparently offer on the standard plan only.....which it ridiculous. Open the attached photo, in the email I just sent you,it shows option 1 for existing customers, option 2 for cancellation. in the top left corner is the 3 HOUR and 57 MINUTES I was left on hold !! Please cancel the service and process the refund to the card used.Respectfully,Quinn E MoulesongOnce again I am in cue for almost an hour waiting for your call back...

Review.Titre: A check got whitewashed
Review.Contenu: A check got whitewashed, drained some of our account without our knowledge or your knowledge. No protection and no notice from you. We've cancelled our service with you...

Review.Titre: My card was hacked and it is listed and…
Review.Contenu: My card was hacked and it is listed and I heard nothing and so a appeal was made and the credit agencies were notified. I enlisted in this service so this would not happen.

Review.Titre: Response time
Review.Contenu: Communication and response time needs to be improvedAs of 1/11/23 no one has reached out like your response said on 12/29

Review.Titre: Believe the bad reviews
Review.Contenu: Edit: March 1stFinally received a call. Representative said they will look into it, and send me an email once resolved. We’ll see. I did appreciate the call though, even though it took a week. ——————-I recently signed up, and should have read and believed the warnings. The site is glitchy. I can’t connect my bank account, so it can be monitored. I’ve emailed customer service twice now, with no response; first email being sent on Monday, second yesterday morning. If a site isn’t functional, and I can’t get anyone to respond, it’s doubtful that I should be able to trust the company to protect me. Sickening. I regret signing up, and I want my money back.Edit: March 1,2022:One week from my original email, and still no response. IdentityForce requested info, through Trustpilot, after my original review. I provided my info and member ID, as there wasn’t a reference number. That was Friday morning. So they would have had Friday and Monday (if only counting weekdays) to contact me. That didn’t happen, either. Trustpilot: I have the emails, and I have proof of membership. I would like to show that this is a verified review, if you can let me know how to send the info.

Review.Titre: What am I paying for?
Review.Contenu: I just had a credit card with fraudulent charges. My bank caught it right away and shut down the card.  I still haven’t received any alerts for you guys about this issue. I would think that would happen at least after they cancelled the card. Then I get an email today from you saying we have you covered and no alerts. To me that indicates I’m paying for nothing. No protection

Review.Titre: I'm trying to get in touch with …
Review.Contenu: I'm trying to get in touch with customer service by phone but the wait is over 30 minutes.  They say that they have your credit report available on your dashboard yet I'm unable to find it.  I apparently have someone that is using my ss# and can't get in touch with anybody.  What is the point of this service if I can't talk to someone?  The alert was helpful, but now I'm stuck.

Review.Titre: I can't figure out how to deactivate …
Review.Contenu: I can't figure out how to deactivate the pointless sex offender alert. I can't get the password recovery to work. Maybe you have program errors pertaining to extended characters? I don't understand your credit bureau alert. Maybe you really have had nothing to report for a long time, and try to pretend importance by generating pointless fake alerts.

Review.Titre: I guess I have to call to find out if…
Review.Contenu: I guess I have to call to find out if my spouse is covered, since I cannot tell from the dashboard and was never given an option to put in his info... Now I have to go check my credit card to see how much I was charged, since for some reason you cannot add that to the dashboard... Plus you don't have an option to opt out of auto renewal...

Review.Titre: No call back
Review.Contenu: I am a new customer and have entered the majority of my information. I do not see where nor can I find a place to enter my stock account or my IRA information. I waited on hold for 20 minutes and hung up. The next day I entered my phone number so that I would receive a call back. No call back. I repeated the process the third day and left my cell number. No call back.I hope your protection service is better than your customer service.

Review.Titre: The Smart SSN Tracker Alert Fiasco
Review.Contenu: The Smart SSN Tracker Alert Fiasco was very disturbing. I tried calling when I got the email and text alerts and had a 200 minute wait. I couldn't wait so I called the next day and left a callback. No callback. Today I received an email explaining the alert was in error and an apology. This was two days after the problem! I should receive a free month's service for the angst you caused.Stephen CapognaHendersonville, NC

Review.Titre: Dissatisfied and Uncertain
Review.Contenu: I'm not sure I am getting enough service for the charge. I noticed my credit card balances are not updated on my dashboard. I do get emails when someone is checking my data. My credit card numbers have been stolen and used but not notified from Identity Force but from the banks. This is only what I have experienced. I am not overly knocking Identity Force but not sure it is worth $200.00 per year. Check out all the companies you may want to go with.

Review.Titre: Aggravated
Review.Contenu: I have not been receiving alerts on my bank accounts and have not since 12/8/2016. I got alerts every time there was activity on any bank or credit card account. They just stopped and I cannot get a valid explanation as to why. Seriously considering cancelling my service as I feel it is a waste of $$ if I get no alerts.EDITED - 15 days later and still NO response.

Review.Titre: It's ok
Review.Contenu: It's ok, it fails to pull my credit score and says to contact a representative.  The security software suite won't install on my new Windows 10 laptop, it says "this app can't run on your pc", but I have it running on my old laptop. Some things to work on, especially the price I pay per year for this service.

Review.Titre: not as good as they think they are
Review.Contenu: not as good as they think they are. i ask for help with the op out services of unwanted credit cards, they say they do this. i asked for help, they said, "by law" they can not help, but they gave me a phone number so i could do this myself. still a member at this time, i hope , if needed, the next service will be there.   t zook   indiana.

Review.Titre: Getting alerts that are not clear as to …
Review.Contenu: Getting alerts that are not clear as to what they are and leave me not knowing if or how I should take action. There is  NO ONE to contact and I am NOW GETTING TEXT ALERTS AT 4:30 AM !!!! This is NOT GOOD. Have someone call me !!! since I can't get anyone when I call.  There are some good features no doubt, but I hope I see improvement on cust. service and better, more timely alerts ASAP.  Not nearly as happy with I.D. Force as I hoped to be.ThanksJohn Alfieri

Review.Titre: The credit reports scores you lists on …
Review.Contenu: The credit report scores you list on my dashboard are so far off my scores from the actual credit bureaus as to be absolutely useless.  Example...my credit score directly from Experian is 841.  But you list my Experian score as 758--an 83 point difference.  What gives?  Scores from the other two credit bureaus are nearly as far off.  How can I rely on the accuracy of your service when you can't even list my credit scores as  anywhere close to what they actually are?

Review.Titre: Many initial features did not work
Review.Contenu: Many initial features did not work - Security question froze and had a hard time starting over - left a call with the help team that was never answered - now the activating the credit card activity does not work two days in a row and yet I have not yet received a call back from the Q and A desk. After reading the rave reviews of this organization, I am surprised at both the problems filling in the initial "blanks" to get started and the lack of a phone call return.

Review.Titre: credit scores wrong
Review.Contenu: I have identity force and credit karma both and the only one where the credit scores accurately update is on  credit karma.  I had paid off over $20,000 in debt on one of my credit cards all in the last 3 months and according to identity force my scores are unchanged where on credit karma they are now in the 830s.  I am very dissatisfied with the results of identity force and will probably be cancelling my account in the near future.

Review.Titre: New website page
Review.Contenu: The website update and changes are not working out for me so well. Credit score does not display, always loading, even if it's the same until the next refresh. The whole page is not well thought of nor easy to check certain items. I'm just not liking it at all. I liked the previous site better, to be honest.

Review.Titre: The account set up does not go…
Review.Contenu: The account set up does not go smoothly.  Links in the welcome emails do not work and the credit monitoring answers to the questions do not register and instruct you to contact member services.  I am leery about the level of protection I will get from a company that has so many new member account set up glitches.

Review.Titre: On hold for 30 minutes so far to cancel.
Review.Contenu: On hold for 30 minutes so far.Trying to cancel my account.Not worth $200.No AI,  6 months in I keep getting alerts for the same transactions.Transferring money from checking to the bank CC, is 2 alerts.  Should be NO alert.Update 4/16:Reply to identiryforce reply to this post:Yup after the callback came at 5:46AM!  I called again and got through in a few minutes.  My cancellation, was based on the phone number I called from, with no other significant verification.  Very secure company.

Review.Titre: Identity Force has a very high price …
Review.Contenu: Identity Force has a very high price tag for very little communication with their customers. I would never renew this service again for the outrageous price of $199. I've received one notification. otherwise I am left to assume all is ok. This service is very overpriced for what they give in return on reassurance.

Review.Titre: Social media & online PC pratection
Review.Contenu: Social media : we should set the user id and not be imposed the user id used in Identity Force (they might not be the same)Online PC protection tools does not work with Bluetooth modern keyboard , it disables the keyboard, not useful.For MAC users the PC protection , as the name suggest (PC), is not useful.

Review.Titre: Not Worth It
Review.Contenu: There is no real reason to keep this service beyond the free trial period. After you complete the internet scrub in the first few weeks, all they will do is tell you about events where your data crops up because they won't take steps like contact webmasters in China to remove your information. There's really nothing they've done for me since that first month, other than argue with me about the value they provide by sending a monthly email that repeatedly says the same thing.

Review.Titre: Lots of problems
Review.Contenu: Lots of problems.  Conspicuously, I just get a spinning beachball with the Credit > Credit Report, Credit > Credit Score, and Credit > Credit Simulator tabs.  The Credit Score Tracker tab worked, but was pretty much useless.  In particular, it told me that it was updated on Mar-1, but the graph ran from Jan-Dec, which suggests that there's a year wraparound happening in the middle of the graph.  If so, why was there no year popup over each month?.  If not, why were the first three months of this year missing?

Review.Titre: Two Part Authentication to Log In
Review.Contenu: I've just been playing "ping pong" for about 10 minstrying to log in to your site, because I keep on getting an INCORRECT  code error. Going back and forth between TWO windows (My email site and IdentityForce log in window) is breaking up my connection.  There must be a BETTER way.

Review.Titre: My checking account was hacked and …
Review.Contenu: My checking account was hacked and between October of 2017 and December, over $3000 was secreted out of the account, mostly in $2-10 increments with two charges of greater than $600. This was missed by Identity Force and without a good explanation, I will cancel the account in the next 2 weeks.

Review.Titre: Nothing But Problems
Review.Contenu: I've been a member for about 24 hours, and I've had numerous problems with your system, and been on the phone with you 4 times (I'm currently on a loooong hold).  Your system has many inconsistencies, and vague directions, and you've made the worst possible first impression.

Review.Titre: I just joined. So far service terrible.  I need help and can't get
Review.Contenu: I just joined on line. I cannot activate monitoring if cards and accounts.  Have been in their phone que all day with no call back. Also no reply to email. Busy as they are I am worried I made a mistake after experiencing such terrible customer service. Will cancel if not rectified soon.

Review.Titre: Always has an excuse for why something is not monitored.  Stop responding.
Review.Contenu: We bought this service mainly to protect our minor children from ID theft.  I noticed that when I opened a checking account for one of our minor children, using their SSN, no flag ever popped up on this service.  When I inquired, I was first told that it has to be with one of the "big banks" that report to them.  Funny, I don't recall seeing that mentioned when we enrolled.  Well, we were enrolled with a huge bank, so they said they would look into it.  Two follows later, no response.I will be terminating this service.

Review.Titre: Terrible customer service
Review.Contenu: Wow - I just had a really terrible customer service experience with you.  And it is the first and only time I have called since I spent a fortune and signed my entire family up.  I just got a rude, robotic jerk on the phone.  I am really not happy!  I would appreciate a response.

Review.Titre: Can only pull credit report once every 3 months …
Review.Contenu: Can only pull credit report once every 3 months. Other free credit report services provide daily updates (very important if victim of identity theft).Site times you out before you have time to review report, so you better print it out quickly.The social media alerts aren't helpful because they don't provide a link to the tweet or account were an issue may exist so you can mitigate.Report data not thorough since not showing addresses, which is how I found out I had identity theft through another free credit report service when I saw a foreign address listed.

Review.Titre: I don't understand the Alerts??
Review.Contenu: I keep getting alerts and when I go look at them they do not tell me anything.  It lists the account I am disputing but does not say if it was removed from my credit, staying on my credit or what is happening.. What am I to do with this information?   Not a user friendly system.

Review.Titre: Activation frustration
Review.Contenu: I do not have a desk top computer. I have been trying to put my information in via my I Pad and an I Pad pro. This has been a very discouraging and frustrating experience. Although your technical people have been helpful, I cannot activate bank and credit card monitoring. I would not have even started this process had I known I would not be able to utilize the whole protection plan. I plan to utilize the service for this year only because I have invested a lot of time in this so far. However, I would not recommend the company at this point. It seems I must monitor my accounts  for now.

Review.Titre: So many transactions
Review.Contenu: So many transactions - so little time.  I did not realize this service would require so much of my time reviewing warnings and deleting emails for my dozen or so accounts.  Also - it would be helpful if each warning mad it clear which account was of concern.

Review.Titre: When I first joined Identity Force
Review.Contenu: When I first joined Identity Force it seemed simple to understand and check. Since you have changed it I have not understood or been able to check my identity I cant find any instructions on what to do. I am totally lost when I go to your web site.

Review.Titre: I clicked through to sign up for a free …
Review.Contenu: I clicked through to sign up for a free trial of IdentityForce using their 30 day free trial promotion link. I thought that I had signed up for a free trial, but I was charged right away, and just phoned and was told that the 30 day free trial was only for their Ultrasecure product, not Ultrasecure + Credit. This was extremely misleading, as if only one of the products was available as a free trial, the link should have gone directly to that product. I have cancelled my subscription (I had been trying for several days to get through on the phone), but IdentityForce has refused to refund me. I am very disappointed.

Review.Titre: New Dashboard is a joke
Review.Contenu: I tried to renew my freeze on credit file. However, the alert email I received has instructions that I can't do at all. I can perform the duty easily on the old dashboard.Now I can't put the freeze on credit file. very frustration!!!

Review.Titre: The format was much easier when you…
Review.Contenu: The format was much easier when you could scroll down through all of your accounts.  Being able to see everything at a glance and with much less aggravation.  It may cause me to cancel my account and seek something more like you had before.

Review.Titre: Our date scores 6 months, Bogas info, make me pay to fix your screwups!
Review.Contenu: Three Credit score from 04/2015, six months old.Red Alert, Red Alert! Old information, I move out of state a year ago after selling my house. I keep the phone number from the last state I lived in, I informed you 1 year ago of the change. And you just figured it out.You say my name and number are tied to 2 old address of which only one was mine. I sold it more then a year ago when I lived in Oregon, I have lived in TEXAS for more then a year.I have been with your outfit for several years, well that mistake I will be correcting Monday morning.Good Bye ID Hello LifeLock they can't be any worse then your company!!

Review.Titre: DON'T HOLD YOUR BREATH !!
Review.Contenu: After I first signed up for the service, I was repeatedly getting the following message from Identity Force: "Your account has been marked for manual identity verification.  Additional steps must be taken to authenticate this account.  Please contact member services at 866-897-6278 to complete activation of credit services."  While I have no objection to working with their Member Service Center to finish setting up my account, they either keep you on hold for hours or promise to call you back in the order that you called (calling me back never happened).  Good luck getting your new account set up properly and in a timely fashion.

Review.Titre: Concerned we are not hearing from you
Review.Contenu: I recently purchased a second home which required me to take a mortgage, run credit reports, etc., and I never heard one time from your service which makes me question what I am paying for since your service says I would be notified if any of those transactions occurred.  Can you explain what I am missing?  The same is true for my wife as she was on the same mortgage, credit reports, etc.   Lastly, our son recently applied for and received his first credit card.  We have him in your service as well and there was never any notification that someone had requested credit cards in his name.   I look forward to hearing from you.

Review.Titre: ARRRGH!!!!
Review.Contenu: Just enrolled on 9/12 due the Eqifax breach, Had some questions concerning site set up so I called the customer number...after 2 days and NO way to get through via phone or message, I believe the company has just taken the phone off the hook and are playing video games or binge watching Game of Thrones!!! Today after getting up and trying again, with no success, I will try emailing them, I also left my number for a call back, but won't be holding my breath. I realize we are in the Eqifax storm, but after 2 days it is very frustrating. I chose this company after researching all the others and they had great reviews, I hope it's true.

Review.Titre: ALERTS?
Review.Contenu: ALERT: Bank and Credit Card Activity AlertTransaction Exceeds Limit - 02/22/2018 5:06:15amThis transfer took place Feb. 20. I guess taking two days for an alert is good?Not really knowing why I spent $20 per month for this.

Review.Titre: On Sunday for Enrollment for Patricia Turco at Treasure Island
Review.Contenu: On Sunday, February 25 at around 7:00AM I tried to assist a 78 year old employee who does not have a computer to enroll. After going thru the process we waited over 20 minutes unsuccessfully to get an authentification code. I then called customer service and was told to try again but DECLINE the Dual authentification which I did. Once again no results. Tried calling back in and was on hold for another 15 minutes then finally left my number for a return call. No call back was received within the next 3 hours before I finally left work and the number I had provided for help. Patricia got a code 4 hours later but the enrollment had expired. So now what do we do?

Review.Titre: No credit union of america in the Financial Transaction Monitoring
Review.Contenu: Why is credit union of america not available on financial transaction monitoring? all that came up was credit union of america investments... this is the whole reason i signed up for identityforce! guess i'll try lifelock..

Review.Titre: Credit score
Review.Contenu: I think it's crap that even though you pay a monthly fee for this service you still have to pay extra to actually see your credit score. Also think it's dumb that there is not an option for me to cancel my service online!

Review.Titre: Setup of account is unnecessarily …
Review.Contenu: Setup of account is unnecessarily difficult and there is no explanation of some of the monitoring selections.  Also no explanation of family member addition (are they covered, or does each person need to sign up).

Review.Titre: WHY CAN'T I GO ANYWHERE ON YOUR WEBSITE …
Review.Contenu: WHY CAN'T I GO ANYWHERE ON YOUR WEBSITE TO GET A RECEIPT.IS THEIR SOMETHING GOING ON? SOME DECETION? CALLED IN TO ACQUIRE ONE AND YOU THINK I WAS ASKING FOR MONEY.I PAY, I SHOULD BE ENTITLED TO A RECEIPT!!

Review.Titre: Why am I not able to change my password
Review.Contenu: Why am I not able to change my passwordWhy is there nobody that answers the phoneWhy did I not get a call back on my cell phoneAre all identity protection companies this bad with clients after money received

Review.Titre: IdentityForce cleared-up the problems about: Poor performance for this client.
Review.Contenu: Some of the information you have listed for me is wrong. On the IdentityForce “Dashboard” for my account, I can see nowhere to change preferences, limits, information, etc. There is no good way to find information. And, no, your phone representative said “I can’t do that.”  It would be nice for me, a client, to be able to monitor YOU in relation to my account. You are just about to lose a client and a good reference also. I suppose this is monitored rarely, but some action should be done or I’m gone. ALERT - GOOD ALERT: I was contacted very quickly by the company and am very satisfied with the information I received, with the consideration I was given.  I am pleasantly surprised. This rarely happens!  Now I have a different view of this company.

Review.Titre: I'm a current customer - new dashbaord is not good
Review.Contenu: I'm a current customer.  Was doing just fine with the old dashboard, but now this new dashboard is very confusing.  For example, I get the Alert that I need to renew my Fraud Alert monitoring with the credit bureaus, and to go to "My Dashboard>My Services>Identity Protection>Fraud Alert.  Guess what, I can't find anything called "My Services".  To be honest, the way the entire dashboard is laid out, everything is spread all over the place that I cannot see a simple list of features I am getting and their status (green/red).  I like the old simple list....much cleaner and all on one page.  Please bring it back.  In the meantime, can you please at least put the "My Services" screen on the dashboard like the guidance says?

Review.Titre: good luck getting someone to speak to you.
Review.Contenu: started a 30 day trial and upon further review decided to cancel the service as it does not fit my needs -- customer service is only available 8-5 m-f --- I have bee trying for 4 days and sat on hold for nearly 30 minutes each time - 3 emails have received no response and my credit card was billed the first day of the 30 day trial (not supposed to until after the trial period). perhaps this is unusual due to the equifax breach but if you are considering this service, you might try calling to see if you can get anyone on the phone -- if you are counting on them to fix a problem, might be nice to think that if needed, someone would respond. 2 stars because its got a good looking easy to use site but I dont see the value if customer service is not responsive.

Review.Titre: So far sub par
Review.Contenu: So far, I’ve had an inadequate and unreliable experience with Identity Force.  First, it’s difficult to trust their reporting is accurate.  For example, I subscribe to their sexual offender monitoring report. The report shows 30 registered sex offenders near my address; however, it is  He same 5 people listed 6 separate times. Second, if these reports are incorrect, then what sorts of discrepancies are in their other reports. Third, the base subscription does not provide access to all features and reports. Many reports require additional costs to upgrade for the service to be fully functional. For example, the basic service allows you to monitor credit cards but you are only allowed to monitor five credit cards.  The ability to monitor more cards is an “add-on.”

Review.Titre: Lots of late and irrelevant data
Review.Contenu: Received 25 alerts at one time built off the concept of "exceeds credit limits". All our charge many small three months old. Seems like I will drop this service. Very unfocused

Review.Titre: Does not pull complete banking / saving …
Review.Contenu: Does not pull complete banking / saving transactions under the report of Bank and Credit Card Activity. Leaves out Capital One completely and only hit/miss Wells Fargo transactions.

Review.Titre: Location of personal record removal are …
Review.Contenu: Location of personal record removal are the same months after months. The option of removal is useless. It tells you you have records to remove but then dosent let you do anything.

Review.Titre: Monitoring 1 person
Review.Contenu: I thought I was going to be monitoring my wife and I. I tried driver liscense monitoring and you can only monitor 1 person. I signed up for equifax and it crashed when I was done.

Review.Titre: It's when problems rise that you can truly judge that kind of service.
Review.Contenu: Today, I received a mail from a Bank with a Credit Card in it. Problem: mail was partially open, and on the envelope, you could see my name "stamped" buy pressure with my name on the stamp, like if it was carbon paper. But, Inside I found a random pre-approval no name card. So far, everything point to the scenario of someone opened a account using my name and stole the card from the envelope to replace it by a random one. After, explained that to on the phone to IdentityForce member support, the suport member answer was sort of "oh, we don't cover that"quite rudely. No advice, nothing. As much I know, to open a bank account, you must prove your ID... Is that not in their range? Or at least telling me what action I should/could take.Then, so far, bad experience: I'm pretty disapointed.

Review.Titre: Disappointed in things missed
Review.Contenu: At first this company seemed OK.  But the service is not very good. Recently, I had fraudulent activity on  a Visa card. The bank alerted me and I closed that account and opened a new account. ID Force didn’t alert me of the new account, although a free (less robust) service I use alerted me! Also, my wife uses a well known competing service. They actually alerted her about a hacked breach with one of our service providers...BEFORE that company even alerted us themselves! Identity Force, not so much. Unfortunately, I paid for a full year to save a bit. I’m only a few months into it, and wish I had gone month to month. According to their web site, no refunds are available if you cancel early. That’s too bad. Still, the service does provide some peace of mind. But for the price, I’d rather join my wife on Life Lock.

Review.Titre: IdentityForce Web Site needs improving
Review.Contenu: The user interface of IdentityForce is limited. I hope the technology IdentityForce uses to monitor customers' identity is better than the company's web site!

Review.Titre: Waste of Money
Review.Contenu: Six months ago my identity was stolen, and someone applied for many dozens of loans and credit cards in my name. I manually applied for credit freezes with all 3 agencies using my police report. But I thought, given that I only get 1 free copy of the report per year, that Identity Force's alerts would be helpful to see updates to it. Not so much. Any little change happens and I get a "red alert" SMS page and an email. Click through to the site? The notification tells me absolutely nothing of value. Paid off a student loan. I get a red alert notification that my loan holder updated their information on my report. Not what they updated,  just that it changed. My credit freeze is finally implemented 8 weeks after I overnighted it to Experian? Same deal. Experian has updated my account. How? With what? Why? Not the best use of $250/yr.

Review.Titre: Since I hired Identity Force
Review.Contenu: Since I hired Identity Force, I have had my bank account hit ($2000 removed) and my email hacked with all my contacts receiving a bogus letter asking for $$$.

Review.Titre: EITHER UPDATE SCORES OR GET RID OF…
Review.Contenu: EITHER UPDATE SCORES OR GET RID OF THEM. SEPT OF 2017 REALLY? ALL YOU EVER SEND ARE BANK PAYMENT ALERTS OR THE MONTHLY 83.XX INSURANCE FOR EACH OF US

Review.Titre: I hope the service works better than …
Review.Contenu: I hope the service works better than the interface. I signed up for my wife and myself, and even paying two full subscriptions I cannot get the software to accept the second drivers license number (exceeds max error). Tried to terminate her coverage, but cannot do that online. Online support contains NO help on how to use the program; only offers publicly available advice on what to do if you are a victim of identity theft; I ALSO want to know how to maximize the use of their tools. A number of product services listed on the My Services tab show as inactive, but when I try to activate them, the program indicates they are already active. I don't know if I am being protected or not.  The only thing I know for certain is that they have all my personal data. Come on, guys. This does not give me any confidence that you know what you are doing! Give me some feedback and I will revise my opinion. If not, I am moving on.

Review.Titre: Didn't get any call or e-mail when someone try to open account with my info.
Review.Contenu: Just received a new credit card which I didn't apply for it.  Just wish I get some e-mail or call when this person started to apply under my name.

Review.Titre: The original system was much easier to undestand.
Review.Contenu: The original system was much easier to understand and had everything at my fingertips.  This seems  unnecessarily confusing.  Don't like it.

Review.Titre: Response to emails/questions about account
Review.Contenu: I have had Identity force for months and get alerts every now and again, which is awesome. But I can not get a response if I have questions. Sad.

Review.Titre: wrong name
Review.Contenu: you have on one of your identify thefts.    pamela y swanso is not my name and I have never lived in any of those places..   how sad ..

Review.Titre: Why does a Google search of my phone …
Review.Contenu: Why does a Google search of my phone number shows all my information however Delete Now report does not show these search results

Review.Titre: This is regarding my recent experience …
Review.Contenu: This is regarding my recent experience over the last couple of days when I got a mail about some SSN alert. When I tried to log in, my log-in was blocked requiring two-factor authentication - this would have been ok but your system had old phone # rather than the updated one and it didn't give me another option such as using email. I had called several times into your customer service to no avail, and finally when I got through, I was on hold for over 2 hours but didn't get anybody on the call. I did get a call later today when the rep changed authentication to email but suggested "it's only one-time change to use email for authentication".
