It should be up to me as the account owner, whether I want to use phone or email for authentication and my account should not have been set up for phone authentication with old phone #. I hope this doesn't happen again and the experience improves going forward! Also, I am still waiting to have this ticket resolved, which has been open for over a month now.

Review.Titre: So far NOT impressed
Review.Contenu: So far, not impressed.  Set this up the day before yesterday and been working on it since trying to input information.  I've added my wife numrous times, but every time I go on, she's not there.  Secondly, she and I share an email address, but it won't let that happen, so I had to use an email I hardly ever check.  Thirdly, I have several questions so called customer service.  I realize that with the Equifax breach there may be longer wait times, but I've now waited 30 mins and no one has answered.  In addition, it doesn't give you a time frame of how long....if my call is so important to you, as your message says, you would answer.  I'm going to now press 1 for a call back, we'll see if that actually works, it never has in the past for any other company I've done that with, just a good way to get you to hang up and ignore you.  If I don't get a call back, I will be canceling my account as it does me no good if I can't set it completely up, and I can't get answers on how to do it.

Review.Titre: Sex Offender alerts are simply false alarms, as no one has ever used my address for anything.
Review.Contenu: The Sex Offender monitoring alerts are a COMPLETE waste of my time.  I have asked how to turn such notices OFF, yet I am told they cannot be turned off.  I get one every few weeks and to-date, not a single one has ever lived on my road, or tried to use my address for nefarious purposes.  It's just like the little boy who CRIED WOLF.  The notices are so commonplace now, I just IGNORE such from IdentityForce.  For me, it's a useless, time consuming waste.  When it comes time to renew, if I still cannot turn OFF such notices I will no longer be a customer.REPLY from A.D. Wade"Please feel free to disregard the notifications."  The whole point of my complaint is, you are a notification company hired by me to watch over my information.  WHY should I have even have to review repetative, false-notifications and waste time in doing so?  WHY can I not simply turn off this type of notice?  We put a man on the moon in 1969, almost half a century ago.  Is it too much to ask to be able to simply TURN OFF unwanted notifications??

Review.Titre: IdentityForce was quick to take my …(
Review.Contenu: IdentityForce was quick to take my money and charge my account when I added my wife to the service.  However, I see no options to enter her social security number or credit cards in her name.  If it's out there, it's very well hidden.  That, in combination with the limited office hours, makes it a bit frustrating to be a new customer.  I called last weekend with a support question.  There was a long queue so I chose the option to leave my number and have them call me back.  They NEVER called me back.Starting to question the wisdom of choosing this service.OK, IdentityForce called me back and informed me that my wife would have a wholly separate account to protect her identity.  I assumed we would have a shared dashboard somehow with both our information.  Not how it works!  My bad.  (interesting that when I posted a negative review I got a call very quickly, but when I called for a support issue I was never called back).  Overall, I'm OK with things now.  My misunderstanding of how the service works led to my above review.

Review.Titre: A little disappointed that adding my …
Review.Contenu: A little disappointed that adding my spouse doubled the monthly price of the plan. Cancelling today and going to LifeLock.

Review.Titre: Lots of Alerts but no help
Review.Contenu: I get a lot of alerts but no support or help[ on what actions I can take, I can't even find what the alert is about.

Review.Titre: NO SMARTPHONE
Review.Contenu: Happen to be someone who does not have a smart phone and having to get a text to login to my account is a real pain.

Review.Titre: Not receiving alerts or returned phone calls
Review.Contenu: I have called twice now on the weekends for assistance.  I have pushed 1 on the voice menu to be called back by the first available service associate.  I have never received a call back.  Your weekend coverage is a completely failed service.  Either have your representatives return calls as promised, or find new representatives that will honor your service commitments.  Same has happened with email.  I sent an email requesting assistance on Friday, November 1, 2017, to date never received a call back or returned email.I setup to receive credit card alerts for purchases over $300.  I have made three purchases over $300.  I received alerts on two purchases, but not third purchase.  I called in to report the problem, the customer service representative told me it could take up to 10 to 14 days to find the problem.  Totally unacceptable.  Based on these three charges, the statistics would prove that I am only receiving alerts on 66% of transactions over $300.  Thus I am paying for services that I am not receiving.  I have deleted the credit card account and reestablished it hoping this may resolve the problem.

Review.Titre: I have large expenditures over $800 …
Review.Contenu: I have large expenditures over $800 from various credit cards and you notify me nine days later, are you kidding .

Review.Titre: Why Cant you Cancel Easily!???
Review.Contenu: No way of Canceling Identity Force and do not want to willingly pay for a service I cannot cancel straight forward

Review.Titre: Cant get our bank in info entered even …
Review.Contenu: Cant get our bank in info entered even though IT IS the correct pass word.Credit score is hardly ever updated.

Review.Titre: It has been over 24 hours since paying …
Review.Contenu: It has been over 24 hours since paying off my car loan and debt consolidation loan but no notifications!

Review.Titre: ISSUES ALREADY-AND UPDATE
Review.Contenu: Only been member for 2 days and already having trouble with not being able to find alerts and information that I'm being notified for. Alert says click on "credit bureau dispute form link" on my credit report which is  no where to be found on my dashboard.  Also having website issues trying to "verify my account" so I can activate the delete alert, but can't get a response by email.  Tried to call regarding billing issues, left call back number and was never called back.  On hold for 25 minutes before being able to talk to someone about this so not calling back about that.  Doesn't make me feel very secure if I get notified about a theft issue that I need to discuss with these folks!UPDATE: I got a call today from Identity Force and resolved my issues. Wendy explained that since the Equifax breach they have been inundated with calls, which is understandable. I also found a voice mail returning my request for a call back, albeit 2 days later, but called back. I do think it's sad that the only way I was able to speak with anyone was to leave a negative review, but in light of the Equifax information I'm willing to give this company another try.

Review.Titre: Filled out all the fields and entered…
Review.Contenu: Filled out all the fields and entered saved only to get an error message and to call customer service.

Review.Titre: Web site has issues working with both…
Review.Contenu: Web site has issues working with both Safari and Firefox on Mac.  Submit button does not always work.

Review.Titre: Very disappointed that Delete Now …
Review.Contenu: Very disappointed that Delete Now service is not available and am considering cancelling my account.

Review.Titre: Credit alerts are given with no…
Review.Contenu: Credit alerts are given with no explination on what the issue is or what you should do about it.

Review.Titre: You need an iPhone and iPad app
Review.Contenu: I find it very cumbersome to navigate your site on my mobile devices where I use 99% of the time.

Review.Titre: I do not like the new dashboard
Review.Contenu: I do not like the new dashboard. It is to confusing for people my age! It is like a cartoon.

Review.Titre: Not user friendly
Review.Contenu: Not user friendly, pain to work with, can't get ahold of them.  I keep forgetting to cancel my subscription, because I honestly don't think it's helping me with anything.  I used to have a great ID guard that alerted me if somebody was using my SSN to open a bank account or something.  This only monitors existing items, which I already do on my own.  Then when I got an SSN alert yesterday, saying my SSN had probably been compromised, I got a report that gave me no information (literally, just my SSN) and "If you have questions contact us at _" and it was blank.  So I tried calling the 1-877 number and four times was immediately put into a "the number you have called is unavailable.  Please leave a message."  There is no way, that sounds more suspicious than the spam phone calls I get.  Finally, I got through and the recording said that my estimated hold time was 56 minutes.  It gave me the option to leave a callback number, which I did, and I did not receive a call back until about 7PM that night, approx. 5 hours later.  I was busy, so I didn't pick up, so I never did resolve the issue.  I'm not dealing with that again.  For $13 a month I expect better service than that.  Now I'm trying to cancel and can't figure out how to do that either!

Review.Titre: Your javascript doesn't always work and…
Review.Contenu: Your javascript doesn't always work and that's actually frightening. I have been unable to add a bank in "Financial Transaction Monitoring" because if I search for my bank nothing happens when I click search. If I hover over one of he provided services (like American Express) I can see the java script it's trying to run: Run script "invokegotologinform('12')"Seeing that and not being able to actually find my bank is a bad experience. So is the lack of high resolution images on all your buttons. The 'close window' button as well as the image buttons for 'edit' and 'activate' are low resolution and look bad on my retina display monitor. This is something that was forgivable a few years ago, but in 2018 tells me you don't update your site very often. Even low end computers have high-resolution screens.Oh, I'm also not crazy about using 2-factor over SMS. If you take security seriously you would know that SMS is easily hackable / with a little bit of social engineering and a call to a cellphone carrier. Maybe use something like Authy? I don't know, just spitballing, but I shouldn't have to. Anyway seeing little cracks like this don't actually instill me with confidence in this service. I just signed up for a year of this. Hope to see things improve.

Review.Titre: Delayed alerts
Review.Contenu: Started the trial. I get credit card alerts 3-5 days after they happen. Useless.

Review.Titre: Poor first impression
Review.Contenu: I'm sorry, but your website is obviously new and I have just paid $240 to debug it for you! You should, at least, offer a discount for the first year of service if you want your customers to tolerate the new "features" of your website. My first hint came when I filled out my profile. Near the end of the process you are suppose to acknowledge the "Terms and Conditions" but the link didn't work, so I couldn't review them. Then, even if I had the chance the review the "Terms and Conditions" the check-off box was apparently invisible. Only after working with Shyesha (sp?) and going thru the profile three times did we realize the "bug".BTW - after you give Shyesha (sp?) a raise for her professionalism I suggest you get her a nice, quiet office nearby. When I worked with her it was really hard to understand her because of the lively conversations going on in the background.So far, in the first 24 hours I have received two alerts, of which only one could be read on the website - the other never loads. There are other bugs - to many to mention - especially as a paying client. I had a friend who owned a successful crane company. He use to say that when he arrived at a job site he could tell immediately, based on the condition of jobsite, what an operators financial books looked like. Right now your website is not projecting a good image for IdentityForce. I only hope your website is secure and my personal data is actually protected.

Review.Titre: Too many menues saying how good you are…
Review.Contenu: Too many menues saying how good you are , lots of potatoes little meat

Review.Titre: search accounts window just searches and then closes
Review.Contenu: search accounts window just searches and then closes nothing happens

Review.Titre: I am having too many issues and cannot …
Review.Contenu: I am having too many issues and cannot get customer service

Review.Titre: I have just started my 30 day free …
Review.Contenu: I have just started my 30 day free membership, and entered all my information into My Services.  The Fraud Alert Reminder is poorly worded for someone who already has a Fraud alert in effect.  I would like a reminder, but not starting today, because I didn't set my Fraud alert today. But I didn't know that was going to happen.  I clicked the ONLY button available, which was Set my fraud alerts. When I saw that took me to Expedian, I closed that tab (since I already have an alert) and went back and now I had another link I could click on "I set my fraud alert, remind me in 90 days." That is true for me - I did set it - 2 months ago. So I clicked on THAT thinking it would give me a way to enter the date I set my fraud alert. But it didn't - it just says "okay, we'll remind you in 90 days." Well that's not right. So I called the phone number to have the reminder either taken off or made so they could change the date, and the woman I spoke to said she couldn't do that. That it was impossible. I think that's unbelievably lame. I'm sure I'm not the only person to sign up for a new IdentityForce account who already has a Fraud Alert in affect. So far, on my first day, I'm not impressed with the IdentityForce experience because 1) that ought to be easy to fix; and 2) the woman on the phone was just not helpful right up front. Since I previously had an experience with a different identity service, I know what their customer service was like, and this one was much worse. And I switched because the reviews for IdentityForce are much better. If I had known that your customer service was worse, I wouldn't have changed.  It's my free 30 days - I still might.

Review.Titre: new dashboard not as informative as…
Review.Contenu: new dashboard not as informative as prior

Review.Titre: Can't reach after hours
Review.Contenu: Useless if can't reach during eeekends

Review.Titre: unable to finish registration online
McAfee caught my information had been…
Review.Contenu: McAfee caught my information had been hacked and posted on the Dark Web and you didn’t even notice that I was hacked!    Not a very good feeling about your capabilities.

Review.Titre: Satisfied overall.
Review.Contenu: Satisfied overall.Recent changes that are not being addressed is concerning.Daily alerts are no longer listed in chronological order on the webpage.Also, the regular alerts are being sent 3-4 days AFTER the event.

Review.Titre: Oustanding Representative!  Weak Phone and Website Service!
Review.Contenu: I would rate the representative, Nicole ☆☆☆☆☆.  She handled my issue professionally, efficiently, and promptly.However, the wait time on hold was long, all three times.  My call was dropped twice.  But I had to wait and call back because the website had not been updated with my credit card information from last year.I appreciate your efforts to improve this aspect of customer service.

Review.Titre: It is difficult to review this service…
Review.Contenu: It is difficult to review this service since they are continually checking but you only hear about it when there is a problem. Still, it is comforting to know that there is an extra line of defence. The service is certainly not cheap hence the lower than perfect score. It does seem to work though as already had 1 notification.

Review.Titre: Right now I am NOT happy
Review.Contenu: Right now I am NOT happy.  I paid for the service up front for one year.  I presume I am close to being adequately protected as I have had no bad reports, etc.  But I have had one reoccurring glitch that I cannot seem to get worked out and do not feel I am getting the proper support from the company to get resolution.  I feel I am spending TOO much time doing the work to try to get the glitch fixed and not enough time enjoying the benefits of the service (protection, peace of mind) I paid for.  Will keep trying for a limited amount of time, but may then cancel service and look for another provider I feel is more customer friendly if I cannot get satisfaction.

Review.Titre: difficult to cancel
Review.Contenu: difficult to cancel, which always leaves a bad taste in my mouth . . . if you are offering an honest product with honest benefits to the consumer, why make it difficult to cancel?  Also very expensive

Review.Titre: My transactions have not been monitored…
Review.Contenu: My transactions have not been monitored for a year - I have contacted them several times and get told that they will get back to me with no response - I think I am paying for a service and not getting everything that I am paying to have

Review.Titre: I don’t actually know what you are…
Review.Contenu: I don’t actually know what you are doing to protect my information.  I pay $10.99 month for what exactly.

Review.Titre: It was a good experience dealing with…
Review.Contenu: It was a good experience dealing with them. Staff were friendly.

Review.Titre: It was difficult to get started after…
Review.Contenu: It was difficult to get started after the Equifax breach.  Slow responses from Support.  Then, some area has to use any server other than Safari.  I downloaded Firefox, but still got the same message.  Credit report is not updated automatically.  Now, I see I'll be charged $339.00 when renewal comes up for only myself and my husband.  Won't be renewing with this company.

Review.Titre: Plan content
Review.Contenu: Disappointed that there isn't a function in this plan that provides overall credit scores from the 3 major credit reporting companies that is accessible in my services.  When I called customer service regarding this service I was advised that that feature was an additional $14.99 a month.  that represents a 74% increase in price for one feature.  I will probably research other companies.

Review.Titre: It takes entirely to long to talk to an …
Review.Contenu: It takes entirely to long to talk to an agent.  When requested I put my name in que to be called back by the next available agent and it has been 5 days and I still haven't heard from anyone.  Now I'm on hold and it has been over 45 minutes.  Since I already know that my name and SSN have been used for identity theft and I'm looking for guidance these delays are unacceptable.

Review.Titre: Confusing service
Review.Contenu: Confusing service.  I was under the impression that I was paying for protection and service ... That there would be monitoring (checking) for threats and action initiated if threats were detected.  However, in the "Frequently Asked..." section online are instructions on what I should be doing that include monitoring and what I should do/notifications if I detect fraud ....  So what am I paying for????????

Review.Titre: I have been trying to speak to you for …
Review.Contenu: I have been trying to speak to you for 4 hours! There is no way to cancel my daughter Kimberly Harbourne's membership. I did not know I could not add her for free. There is no where on this web site even to cancel the membership it self. Please send me an email telling me you did this. Thank you Arlena and do NOT show the name Tuttle on my account when it is opened.

Review.Titre: When I asked Customer Service how was I …
Review.Contenu: When I asked Customer Service how was I to register my wife for monitoring when she uses my eMail address for her eMail I was told your software stipulated she must have her own eMail address so make one for her. When I asked how she would be monitored I was told via her "fake" eMail ID. Doesn't sound right to me! As an aside, the initial contact was unable to use "please" when it"s use was advisable. New world!

Review.Titre: 10 minutes after I signed up with IDF I …
Review.Contenu: 10 minutes after I signed up with IDF I started receiving email from at least 25 sources I never signed up to receive.  It is very annoying to unsubscribe each emailer and takes up a great deal of my time.  I haven't signed up or given my email address to another venue or vendor except you so whoever you sold my info to is sending me all these emails.  Please do not forward my information to anyone else without my permission.P Bernhardt

Review.Titre: Good platform but why go 1/2 way?
Review.Contenu: This is a good platform , however, there should be the option to re-run credit reports monthly , isn't the idea to stay on top of your credit and all the factors that comprise it? Being able to do this loses a gap that now exists . I am contemplating changing to a service that does this, I believe there is at least 1 and will check it out.  This company should do this ASAP in my opinion.

Review.Titre: amex card compromised
Review.Contenu: recently my amex credit card ending in 3003 was used for fraudulent transactions. American Express contacted me and then declined the attempted fraudulent purchases. cancelled the card and replaced with new cardNot sure if Identify force should have picked up on this case of attempted fraud. should I have expected some type of notification from Idently force. not sure what I am paying for?

Review.Titre: Services don't seem to be working properly
Review.Contenu: This was my first time logging on. The initial set up has taken about an hour. Everything worked fine except the credit score/credit report. The "wheel" has been turning continually for about 30 minutes with no result. I have given up and will try again another day. If it doesn't work again, I will try and contact you by phone. So all in all, a bit frustrating.

Review.Titre: Average
Review.Contenu: Its really hard to justify if this service is of any use as all you get are the occasional emails with zero content really pertaining to anything worthwhile.It is possible that everything is done in the backend and without hassling the 'user' but without getting any type of report indicating if your identity/accounts have been tried to be obtained its really hard to say if thats the case.I don't think its bad it just might not be for me.

Review.Titre: Poor Customer Service - Update
Review.Contenu: I have been very disappointed with the service I have, or should I say, have not received.  I am cancelling my membership. Update: I was contacted by the Member Services Specialist/Manager and am willing to retain my membership on a trial basis for two months.  I have updated to 3 stars and will further update if Identity Force can stand behind their promise to resolve the issues.

Review.Titre: Not  very informative
Review.Contenu: My wife and I want to have the highest quality and service provided. We want the best protection for our credit and security.  So far we feel that the updates and information reporting is lacking.  I believe Alot could be resolved if their were an actual mobile app for quick access to our information. So we are going on the theory that no news is good news.

Review.Titre: Trouble with Scrambler
Review.Contenu: The only issue I have had is the keyboard scrambler interacts with my other internet security program (Webroot) and causes all my typing to be visibly scrambled so that I don't know what I am typing.  I have had to uninstall IDForce from my laptop and have not yet resolved the issue.  Otherwise I am pleased with the thoroughness of the services offered.

Review.Titre: Websites with my name
Review.Contenu: I just googled my name feeling pretty secure that not much would pop up but many professional listings sites came up giving either totally wrong, misleading, or very old information about me. I was not informed that these websites mentioned me. If I could figure that out by googling my name, why didn't IDF find those and alert me?

Review.Titre: account number
Review.Contenu: When I had an identity theft, I called your number.  You were closed and the recording said to call AIG and gave me a number and a policy number to report to them.  The policy number, according to AIG, was a military number and confused the people there.  I looked everywhere in my account on line and couldn't find any other policy number.

Review.Titre: I find it difficult to believe that …
Review.Contenu: I find it difficult to believe that this would be effective when I have transactions over the limit on the 21st and no notification until the 2nd of the following month.  This does not meet my expectations and don't see any preventive value that I would  get from my card providers anyway.  I am thankful that I have not been in need of your services as if it takes this long to notify I cannot imagine what it would take to cure or even delay significant damage to my accounts by outside forces.

Review.Titre: The new website is terrible
Review.Contenu: The new website is terrible!  Why did IdentityForce  mess with the previous layout, which was well organized and easy to navigate?The new site makes it very difficult to locate information.  I find that I am spending much more time trying to find and open places in the site.  It's very frustrating.

Review.Titre: Credit scores and information are as …
Review.Contenu: Credit scores and information are as much as 2 months behind other sites.EDIT:Ok, The following are scores taken from three other credit sites on August 1, 2017. One site is owned by Transunion, one by Equifax and one by Experian.My average credit score from Transunion is 802. Identity Force says it is 742.My average credit score from Equifax is 798. Identity Force says it is 752.My average credit score from Experian is 798. Identity Force says it is 701.Consequently I have canceled my account and moved to another site.

Review.Titre: Input Validation
Review.Contenu: Input ValidationI was careful while inputting my bank account and credit card numbers but the UI provides no validation or verification that what I have entered is valid and being actively monitored. I could have made a mistake, there is no way for me to see that my accounts are protected.

Review.Titre: Not sure what is going on
Review.Contenu: Not sure what is going on. New member - tried to get my wifes info put in, I paid for both of us... or at least at sign up I did. I input all my bank account info and it appears to have not taken... when I tried to input again, I got a red bar saying to call customer service but when I tried to click on the call button, it did not work? So I googled and got a CS number - called and was on hold for over 10 minutes... at work so I had to go. Will try to figure this out after work. If I cannot get any satisfactory results, I will cancel tomorrow.

Review.Titre: Not what I thought I was signing up for!
Review.Contenu: I signed up for a plan/coverage after reading and researching for weeks. I read reviews, asked for opinions from friends, etc. I have had my SS# used to open a cell phone account, so I wanted my information monitored. Long story short, all of my research didn't pay off. I had my info used again to open another cell phone account, and it wasn't picked up by Identity Force. Their reason was because I didn't choose the right plan/coverage. Needless to say, I cancelled my plan immediately! Total waste of money!!

Review.Titre: Time Delay in Alert related activity
Review.Contenu: I did a follow up on a credit alert from Equifax concerning activity on a credit card that I did not use in many years.  After spending considerable waiting time contacting Bank of Amer - fraud dept it turns out the card was closed which triggered the alert.  That is good.  However, the card was closed over 3 weeks ago.  Is there anyway Identity Force can put some pressure on these credit monitoring folks to forward this information quicker?  A lot of damage could have been done if the activity had been true fraud.  I did appreciate getting the Alert.

Review.Titre: Multiple duplicate alerts
Review.Contenu: You often issue multiple alerts for a transaction. I verify by checking each account including the checking account. Getting to the point where I am ignoring alerts assuming that they are duplicates which I have already checked out. I also receive alerts that are older than 6 months.

Review.Titre: I've tried to contact Identity Force …
Review.Contenu: I've tried to contact Identity Force for 2 straight days to no avail. I have chosen to be called back but have yet to a receive a call back. I've waited on hold for 3 straight hours for 2 days straight. I understand the breach but this is kind of ridiculous. I haven't received any updates to my tri-monthly credit score which should've populated an update as of yesterday. I would appreciate to know what exactly is going on with that. I want to give you guys a 5-star rating but it's hard when no one is available to answer your questions.

Review.Titre: I am a new customer today and already …
Review.Contenu: I am a new customer today and already have problems trying to input information.   When in "Add accounts" it says not compatible with the Safari browser and indicates should download Chrome or Firefox.  I have done so and even in Firefox I still get the same message.

Review.Titre: Don't wake me up!
Review.Contenu: Everything is fine, but I do not appreciate the messages in the middle of the night when a bank or credit card transaction takes place. Last night I was awakened at 2 a.m. by the ding-a-ling of a text message. Can you guys wait until 6 or 7 in the morning (Alabama time)?

Review.Titre: Credit scores reported on IF don't look to be up-to-date
Review.Contenu: I just signed up for IF, after getting a notification from Identity Guard that my new credit scores are available. I decided to see what was the current best reviewed credit monitoring company, after using Identity Guard for the last several years (with no major complaints). After deciding to sign up with IF, I note that my credit scores reported (by Identity Force - after signing up for a new account with them) look to be the old numbers previously reported to me by Identity Guard and not the current ones (which are better). A bit disheartening as a new IF customer.

Review.Titre: Wendy was very helpful and patient in…
Review.Contenu: Wendy was very helpful and patient in explaining the details of the Identity report. She took her time and explained things fully. The customer service person I had just before her sounded impatient and condescending. I would give Wendy a 5, and the rude guy a 1!

Review.Titre: A few irks...
Review.Contenu: It would be nice to be able to have all of our family member's information on one account. Instead, we had to split up the account into 2: one for me and my son and one for my wife.Also, how come I cannot activate credit monitoring for my child's SSN?

Review.Titre: The information you provide on alerts …
Review.Contenu: The information you provide on alerts can be confusing and alarming. For example, I received a Smart SSN Tracker Alert and there should be a FAQ page associated with this info. What does "source header?" What do the dates mean since many are very old? While your instructions say to notify one of the credit bureaus directly, there is no link on the top of the Identity Force Dashboard for a Credit Dispute Filing and as you know, it is nearly impossible to contact the bureaus by phone currently. Customer service needs to improve especially during the 30 day free trial period!

Review.Titre: i am a new member and am not happy with …
Review.Contenu: i am a new member and am not happy with client service.  It took over 24 hours to get a return phone call (while in quench's) and stil have not received a response to two email questions.I cannot find out how to pull actual credit reports - not just scores

Review.Titre: Credit reports are from 2015 etc.
Review.Contenu: Credit reports are from 2015.Also whenever I get an alert and go to your website it gives me a way to check the problem by going to another website, but there's always a warning not to click on the website unless I'm sure it's safe. How am I supposed to know if it's safe? Shouldn't that be your job to check that before posting the site?Update... I was told there is a way to update your credit report. It seemed that it should happen automatically from the description on the website.Owner called and was very helpful.Still unable to check if warnings are important.

Review.Titre: Health Acct monitoring
Review.Contenu: Currently, the set-up for this service is simply an acct number.  It would be really helpful to have a field for the company / organization and a field fo the Dr.  It would be much easier to understand what I as a Idenity Force customer have set-up. Thanks,Steve M

Review.Titre: A Fraud alert reminder was issued
Review.Contenu: A Fraud alert reminder was issued. It instructed  me to click on " my services".  I looked and looked, but could not find it because "my services" had been removed from the dashboard.  Should have told me to click " credit"

Review.Titre: Alerts are unclear
Review.Contenu: The alerts give very little information and I am unclear as to what I should be doing.  As an example are the last two alerts I got on my phone number.  They show a link that I am uncomfortable clicking on to see what it is since I don't recognize the address.

Review.Titre: I not getting updates like I asked when …
Review.Contenu: I not getting updates like I asked when I set up my account. Moreover, I canceled my card and I never received a text nor email telling me I ended my services. Therefore, I have concerns about response time of informing me about my personal information.

Review.Titre: I think I really like IDF but I get …
Review.Contenu: I think I really like IDF but I get alerts and have no clue what they mean.  A definition of the alerts would be most helpful.  I cannot seem to find any definition for the alert.  The review tab on my latest alert didn't explain anything at all.

Review.Titre: Your website does not accommodate …
Review.Contenu: Your website does not accommodate someone with no work number.When putting your credit card information in it asks for security code but no explanation as to what that is or where to find it.My bank does not use a password but sends a security code

Review.Titre: Ambiguous alerts//call to action:
Review.Contenu: I guess I feel better having implemented this monitoring service. However, when I do get an alert, it's really not clear what I can do about it. I'm concerned about my credit being checked by companies that I do no business with and haven't initiated a relationship with. With this service I get a notification when my credit report is pulled, but there's really no help in preventing this from occurring or determining why it's happening. It's like being you're at risk and then nothing.....Don't really know that this service is actually accomplishing anything or protecting me from fraud.

Review.Titre: Some of the reports are useful
Review.Contenu: Some of the reports are useful, but some such as the email monitoring one is pretty useless. The email one lets you see where your email address might be used, but it's extremely, if not impossible, to do anything about it. The web monitoring application is pretty useless since I have other safeguards in place. The Three Bureau Credit Report Monitoring Alert and the Smart SSN Tracker Alert are useful. I was already aware of the contents of each, but it makes it easier to check on a regular basis. Currently, it's too early to tell if this service is the best for my family or if I will select a different one at the end of 1 year.

Review.Titre: The credit scores in the credit product …
Review.Contenu: The credit scores in the credit product do not match those that you get from the agencies.  In addition, the credit tool is very weak in how it presents the data compared to other products.  But the key issue is that it is not accurate.

Review.Titre: Bank account monitoring FAIL
Review.Contenu: I've tried various times to add my small local bank to the service and Identity Force can't find it.  If it can't find the bank account and Master Card isn't one of the credit card options it seems to be a waste of my $200.

Review.Titre: your system won't let me put my information in this is serious
Review.Contenu: I'm  New customer trying to get my information into the system and I'm getting extremely frustrated I'm using Google Chrome for the browser is it suggested I keep trying to put in my information at all took one bank account number and then it kept telling me it wouldn't let me in there because I had to use Google Chrome and I'm using Google Chrome and ready to scream I can't get my info in the system help help help help  today is Sat  1:47 pm wasted about three hours trying to get this to take in the system it's not having any effect I tried to call and got put on a little help call me back   Upset customer 😩

Review.Titre: No updates since January 2018
Review.Contenu: No updates since January 2018.  Why isn't my credit being corrected.  I had a credit score of 813 and since we hired you it's only up in the 700's and not at Equifax where the hack was.  I don't understand this.

Review.Titre: I am disappointed...I DON'T bank online …
Review.Contenu: I am disappointed...I DON'T bank online but apparently I must sign up with all my banks online in order to get the alerts. I was under the impressive I could simply list my account numbers in the system to have this done.

Review.Titre: Lack of support for Apple products such …
Review.Contenu: Lack of support for Apple products such as Safari or the Mac OS was not apparent when purchasing this product.  This has been a big disappointment and would probably have reconsidered if this was stated in the advertising.

Review.Titre: So far o good but..
Review.Contenu: So far o good but... when i try and activate "delete now" it says i activated it but the page shows it as not activated and how do I know I really put a credit freeze on? How do I tell it actually happened?

Review.Titre: IdentityForce has room for …
Review.Contenu: IdentityForce has room for improvements.My review is based on web interface, notifications, and customer service. I have not, yet, needed any type of restoration for identity theft.The web interface is cludgy and difficult to understand. I have used other services to check my credit reports and score and the steps to updating this information is very clear. IdentiyForce has many features, but while I see the features listed, there is no description given before clicking to activate them. Today I received notification of an alert. When I called customer service I was told there was an 80 minute wait time. Of course the notification has me on edge and 80 minutes is just too long to wait.

Review.Titre: The Transaction Monitoring function …
Review.Contenu: The Transaction Monitoring function keeps trying to load something in the right hand side of the screen, so I can't set my alerts on it for anything.  Everything else on the site loaded quickly with no problems.

Review.Titre: Service is great, but no mobile app??
Review.Contenu: The service is great, but I miss apps. Who doesn't have mobile apps these days. When I login on my iPhone, there isn't even a mobile view. How am I supposed to view my dashboard using the full site view.

Review.Titre: Beware - need to pay for an additional spouse membership
Review.Contenu: Really helpful information, easy to setup,  However, I attempted to add my wife after original setup  and was told that I would have to purchase a new membership at the cost of mine ($19.00 x 2 = $38.00)

Review.Titre: I am surprised that you do not provide …
Review.Contenu: I am surprised that you do not provide a secure email portal for communication. I do not see the point in having my questions be sent over a public email server which may be breached. Thanks,S. Nirou

Review.Titre: I am a new subscriber and am unable to …
Review.Contenu: I am a new subscriber and am unable to enter any credit card or bank accounts.  The site spins for several minutes and then reports that there is a "technical" problem.  Very frustrating!!

Review.Titre: Impossible to link some of my accounts.
Review.Contenu: I lost count on how many times I tried to link one of my credit card accounts but failed, even though I consistently entered the correct info.I give up, and I am thinking about cancelling my service.

Review.Titre: A bit frustrated
Review.Contenu: Some frustration removing my information internet as well as they make you go through all the steps which I could have done without this service as downloading medical ID and bank account information

Review.Titre: Spelling Mistake on Family Member
Review.Contenu: You dont have any way on changing a mistake I made while typing in a family member. This is very important for tracking purposes. If I can't get this corrected I will have to terminate my service

Review.Titre: Missing some basics
Review.Contenu: 1. No compatible with Safari browser2. Says "Get More Protection" and give you a % but then links to a page with zero guidance as to what you need to do to increase your protection.

Review.Titre: Cannot activate account because …
Review.Contenu: Cannot activate account because impossible to activate text alerts even though I complete and save the mobile phone info. Only 90% activated. And help line only available during office hours. !

Review.Titre: How to delete alerts w/ new dashboard?
Review.Contenu: The new dashboard design seems to have forgotten to include a way to delete alerts! No trashcan icon or any way to select a group of them to delete or any way I can see to do this any more.

Review.Titre: Some features Do Not Work
Review.Contenu: Either your website is too slow or your app for monitoring bank and credit card accounts does not work. I have tried repeatedly to "Activate" this feature, and it does not respond.

Review.Titre: OK, but website access glitchy
Review.Contenu: Signup was straightforward, and most of the initial account setup went smoothly with one glaring exception. I cannot activate Band and Credit Card Activitty in the Financial Transaction Monitoring section of services. When I click the "Activate" button, a window pops up, and I see a list of "Popular Accounts" on the left, and on the right I get a spinning "Retrieving information..." that never returns. I've let it spin for over an hour. Tried calling tech support, but of course, like everyone else, I can't seem to get through despite waiting for over an hour. Downloaded the app to my phone, hoping to use that, but when I click on the Bank Accounts section, it simply pops up a message telling me to go log in from a computer! C'mon guys, really?

Review.Titre: I really just wanted to point out how …
Review.Contenu: I really just wanted to point out how difficult it is to cancel a subscription. Logged in I can't find anywhere to do it short of contacting support, which is pretty annoying.

Review.Titre: Poor account info on website
Review.Contenu: My account information does not include how much my service fee is, when I signed up, and when the billing occurs.  No clear way to end your monthly service with Identity Force.

Review.Titre: Suddenly receiving sex offender …
Review.Contenu: Suddenly receiving sex offender monitoring alerts. Don't want them. Not even for my current address. Can't figure out how to turn them off.  Not happy with this.

Review.Titre: Not lifelock or even close in 30 days of heavy fraud
Review.Contenu: I have been in the middle of what I would consider serious identity theft over the last few months.  Within the last 30 days I have been notified by lifelock the same day as inquiries posted while identity force takes several days to notify.  Lifelock has had the issues resolved several times before I am contacted by I.F. When I say contacted I am referring to a email from Iforce saying to check my account and seeing the inquiry.  Whereas my contact from L.L. sprang into immediate action trying to resolve the issue for me and when unable to do so again contacted me to tell me how to resolve the issue and to give me phone #'s for quick contact rather than jumping through the normal hoops of calling companies.  Iforce is not worth the money and thus far has provided about the same information as the free service credit karma.

Review.Titre: My Online account details
Review.Contenu: Very hesitant to provide you with all my online account information and login details - I thought I was trying to protect that info not share it on the web?

Review.Titre: account set up entry is very clunky and …
Review.Contenu: account set up entry is very clunky and redundant. why enter credit card numbers in multiple places as an example? enter once and apply services as needed.

Review.Titre: Credit Monitoring page is very frustrating!
Review.Contenu: On the credit cart monitoring page there's no scroll bar. i only see 8 accounts. But the messages says I've entered 10 and can't enter any more.

Review.Titre: I would like information on how to respond to credit alerts
Review.Contenu: I would like information on how to respond to a transaction that is not mine.  Calling is not helpful when the office is closed or the wait is hours long.

Review.Titre: Whats needed
Review.Contenu: Everything working as it should so far, You need to support mac osx and an "app" for mobile devices would make it a "complete" package.

Review.Titre: I can't seem to add some important…
Review.Contenu: I can't seem to add some important account numbers for protection. Such as......401k, IRA, Colleg 529 Savings plan. I'm not happy about that!

Review.Titre: Credit Scores not Current
Review.Contenu: The website still shows my credit scores from 2016. Since I am currently paying for this service, my credit scores should be updated frequently.

Review.Titre: Text Updates
Review.Contenu: I would like to receive text updates, and I would rate your services higher if I could, but unfortunately it is incredibly inconvenient to not be able to set up a time period during the day in which to receive them.  I do not appreciate receiving the alerts from 11PM to 7AM.  When I contacted customer service to see if adjusting/limiting the time period was possible the CSRep was incredibly unsympathetic and acted as though I was an inconvenience in even bothering to call him with my question and directed me to login and turn them off.  When I asked how to do so he let out a very audible sigh of disgust and then gave me a brief and abrupt explanation of how to do so.  I had no idea that may calling for information and a request from a service that I subscribe to and pay for would be so ill received.  I would recommend your products to others, but I cannot at this time due to the way I was treated by placing a call to your company.

Review.Titre: How can I enter my financial accounts…
Review.Contenu: How can I enter my financial accounts in ths system when I enter a bank like chase nothing happens.  I cannot get the system to work.

Review.Titre: California Credit Union
Review.Contenu: I cannot add my California Credit Union accounts located at californiacu.org/to my Bank and Credit Card Activity. Please correct this.

Review.Titre: i would like to pull a new credit …
Review.Contenu: i would like to pull a new credit report frequently to review.  Your service appears to only allow a few annually.  This is not good.

Review.Titre: Your instructions lead to dead ends
Review.Contenu: Your instructions lead to dead ends.  Says to adjust alerts, go to Dashboard and select My Services, which is no where to be found.

Review.Titre: Drivers License and Mother's Maiden Name Monitoring Issue
Review.Contenu: So far, my questions have been answered to my satisfaction by your extremely friendly staff.  However, I called to ask why Driver's License Monitoring and Mother's Maiden Name Monitoring are not showing up on my account or my wife's account, but they do show up on my children's Childwatch accounts...very odd.  Both myself and my wife purchased the Ultrasecure + Credit package, and I was told on the phone those items are not on our account because because we signed up under the Equifax Breech discount.  This is an unacceptable answer because I was purchasing the "Ultrasecure + Credit" package, not the Equifax Breech version of the "Ultrasecure + Credit".  If I knew that was the case, I would have paid the full purchase price.  It makes me wonder what other services I am missing.  I hope this is just a technical issue that can be resolved easily.  I was impressed with your service at first, and I don't want to start having doubts that I should have went with another provider.  Thank you for you time.

Review.Titre: Got false positive
Review.Contenu: Does not do exact match on email address. Even if email address does not exactly match, red flag is generated for alert.

Review.Titre: Good, but hard to follow for one not in this field.
Review.Contenu: Why is my latest Dashboard entry dated 5-31 when today is 6-24? Why is my Identity Health Score dated 8-28 of last year?

Review.Titre: Incorrect Credit Scores
Review.Contenu: The Credit Scores are not correct for me.  According to Credit Karma abd other sources, my credit scores are over 800.

Review.Titre: So far, so good
Review.Contenu: So far, so good.  I had a problem adding cards and accounts to be monitored with Chrome browser, but IE worked fine.

Review.Titre: Just signed up
Review.Contenu: Just signed up.  Found out some of their services not compatible with Apple iMac.  Disappointing.  Not acceptable.

Review.Titre: Good Features, Needs a Mobile App
Review.Contenu: Sometimes there's a bit too much data without enough explanation.  Popups with further direction would be nice.

Review.Titre: Activation is not easy
Review.Contenu: why is signing up and paying for your service so easy yet activating all that you have paid for is so difficult.

Review.Titre: I was hoping for a service with a phone app
Review.Contenu: I only get notices via email to check my online account.  I want quick notifications that pop up on my phone.

Review.Titre: I DO NOT like the new website
Review.Contenu: I DO NOT like the new website.  The old one was MUCH better and easy to understand and easier to navigate.

Review.Titre: why wasn't I notified that my credit …
Review.Contenu: why wasn't I notified that my credit card was fraudulently  used 2 days ago. Citibank called my wife?

Review.Titre: New and unsure
Review.Contenu: I'm still new and populating information.  Not sure what I'm getting, reading, needing, etc...

Review.Titre: The credit scores are wrong
Review.Contenu: The credit scores are wrong.  My credit scores are in the high 700s. I have even been over 800.

Review.Titre: As a general rule,I do not give more…
Review.Contenu: As a general rule,I do not give more than 5 stars.  So far you guys have been great!

Review.Titre: I always have trouble getting to my…
Review.Contenu: I always have trouble getting to my site. If I call rather than give up trying to reach my site, your people are helpful, understanding, and easy to understand. Too often however I just give up and ignore your alerts. So far, the alerts have been sex offenders and I don't have any children that live here.

Review.Titre: I’m giving the 4 ⭐️‘s stars because the…
Review.Contenu: I’m giving the 4 ⭐️‘s stars because the couple of times I’ve contacted the Identity Force it’s soooooo much to navigate through when all I want is  to understand what’s going, on why and how my situation will be handled. I’ve received several fraud alerts, however, they have been from my bank not IF. Why is this so?

Review.Titre: I am glad to have Identity Force’s…

Review.Titre: Going elsewhere
Review.Contenu: On Monday, October 25th I tried to enroll with Identity Force.  I got to the authentication part, and it failed. It would not accept the password that the system suggested for me, so I tried to change the password.  In that process, I was to confirm answers to security questions that I chose.  One of the questions was not one that I chose, so it would not allow me to change my password.  I have been trying for the past 3 days to get this fixed, and every time I FINALLY talk to someone it's not their department and they are going to refer to someone.  I have talked with 3 departments so far. I was only trying to protect myself because on Sunday, someone tried to get a credit card in my name with my social security number. I told them this, and they were going to have that department call me back and help me with this, but no call back.  At this point, I just want my money back and I will go elsewhere. When I told them this today, she told me that department will call me back.  We will see.9-27 - After my review, I received a response from Identity Force and had all issues resolved.  They were very apologetic and helpful.

Review.Titre: It worked

My only issue is that I have called the service twice - and their customer service associates - both times -were one of the most uninformed and least helpful of anyone I have reached out to. A little more coaching on what they can advise a consumer to do would go a LONG way.

Review.Titre: Updated Review (from 1 star to 4)
Review.Contenu: After having a rocky start, Identity Force has since redeemed themselves by fixing all the issues regarding my account. Not yet a 5-star experience because of the rough beginning and needing time to evaluate the service, but things are definitely looking up and based on how hard they worked for the resolution of all things, I think I can now say this company is worth a try. Their price alone is enough to dictate a closer look.

However, alerts have popped up at in opportune times of the day and days of the week and they have caused me a bit of anxiety. My anxiety has grown into high anxiety until I've had a chance to speak with a representative of Identity Force which is usually only M - F,  7-7 am-pm EST. The end result has been some very anxious weekends.When I have been able to speak with a Identity Force representative, the anxiety level goes down substantially. The print, 24 - 7 coverage would make for many more satisfied customers.

Review.Titre: CHILD WATCH
Review.Contenu: I ADDED MY CHILDREN UNDER CHILD WATCH BECAUSE THE SOCIAL SECURITY CARDS HAD BEEN STOLEN. I WAS ALLOWED TO PAY FOR A YEAR OF SERVICE AFTER ONLY ENTERING CHILDREN NAME, BUT WAS NEVER PROMPTED TO ENTER SS#. ONLY UPON LOOKING UNDER THE MY SERVICES TAB TO VERIFY THAT THE PERSONAL INFO AND SERVICE WAS CORRECT, DID I SEE THAT NO MONITORING HAD BEEN ACTIVATED. I THEN HAD TO CLICK THE MONITORING SERVICE AND ENTER THE SS# THERE TO ACTIVATE. I AM GLAD I LOOKED, OTHERWISE I WOULD HAVE PAYED FOR NO SS# PROTECTION FOR MY CHILDREN OTHER THAN THERE NAME WAS ON FILE. IF PAYMENT WAS TAKEN I SHOULD HAVE BEEN PROMPTED TO ADD THE SS# SO THAT MONITORING COULD BEGIN

Review.Titre: Pretty impressive online dashboard
Review.Contenu: Pretty impressive online dashboard.  Easy to sign up and get started. Two suggestions:1.  The protection status gives you a percentage.  I'm at 87%.  I've added and activated every possible item I can think of (lost wallet, transaction monitoring, bank accounts, etc.) but cannot seem to get to 100%.  It doesn't tell you what else you are missing to get to 100%.2.  The credit scores lack information.  It doesn't tell you anywhere that I can find what model was used to determine the score.  My FICO scores are 821, 829, 831.  These scores came in at 798, 784, 771.  They should provide what information on what types of scores these are (FICO, Vantage Score, their own model, etc.).

Review.Titre: It would improve the signup and account …
Review.Contenu: It would improve the signup and account configuration is you added some mouse-over popups and hint messages on the entry screens.  We had to reason out some of the formats that the entry screens would allow through quite a bit of trial and error.  There were no error explanations to assist us, just an inability to proceed to the next step. For example your password entries on the account tracking allow pasting but reject the use of this without any explanation.  This results in confusion why a valid tracking password is not recognized.  A simple hint would resolve this.  Similarly the tracking account entries do not succeed if the financial institution has your account setup with two-factor authentication since there is not an opportunity to respond to the second validating code needed.  We had to remove the two-factor authentication on our bans and credit unions to allow us to setup IdentityForce.  The use of CLOSE WINDOW to accept and submit entries is a bit confusing since this button is more commonly used to exit a window that accept an entry.  Perhaps a SUBMIT or SAVE labelled button would be better combined with an alternative CANCEL button.We like some of the features and the layout of some of the site.  For example, the Services table is powerful and simple.  It would be improved by the use of hints as mentioned above.

Review.Titre: Maybe better wording on email alerts?
Review.Contenu: I just started using my trial subscription and will likely continue.  But a few thoughts struck me today...I received my very first two IdentityForce emails on my iPhone while happily shopping with my wife at Costco.  The subject lines read: "Smart SSN Tracker..." and "Sex Offender Monitoring Update".    I glanced at the "Sex Offender" email and saw: "...while this does not necessarily mean you are a victim of identity theft..."  OMG!  Immediately, I think: "Crap!  Someone on the Dark Web stole my SSN and they've dragged my identity into some sort of sex crimes!"  This hung over my head like a cloud until I could get home and visit the provided links.   How thrilled I was to discover that the "Sex Offender" email was to show me a list of sex offenders in our vicinity -- and not that my identity had been wrapped up in some devastating crimes as I'd feared.  My initial panic wasn't due to a guilty conscience.  [OVERSHARE ALERT...] When I got married at age 24, I was a virgin by choice, so...  No illicit encounters in my life.  Ever.  Thus, my panic on the way home from Costco was: "How will I clear my name if it's really bad?  Hire an attorney?  How costly is that?"    ALL OF THIS TO SAY:  IdentityForce is obviously a GREAT service -- especially now that I can savor the value of the emails that initially caused me concern.  BUT...maybe on the email banner it should say something like: "SEX OFFENDERS IN YOUR AREA -- UPDATE".  That communicates more clearly and mitigates the drama for new customers.And, to a lesser degree of urgency, maybe the other email banner could be something like: "SMART SSN VERIFICATION UPDATE."    Because if you put the two existing banners together, it tends to present a scary snapshot.  Just thought I'd share with you my morning adrenaline.

Which I did on 6/29/2021; but didn't complete your required application until 7/11/2021.I also signed up with an Joseph Lyons Law Firm in Cincinnati, OH who is now handling my class action lawsuit against 20/20 Eye Care Network.I researched and found there is a location In Hialeah, fl (Miami-Dade cty also). I live in Palm Beach cty (West palm beach, fl.)I was told by Joseph Lyons Law Firm in Cjncinnati OH that since they have so many victims like me In the Florida area, that the 1st court hearing will be held in Federal Court in Ft. LAUDERDALE, FL which is in Broward Cty. South Cty below Palm Beach Cty and North of Miami-Dade Cty.20/20 Eye Care Network that the data breach occurred in more than one standard location. More than 1 location. That's why there r more than various police depts and multiple FBI agencies involved in this tremendous data breach. I am one out of more than 3 million victims.And it will take more than 1 year 2 make settlement 4 all registered and effected victims.IDENTITY FORCE ULTRA SERVICES IS DOING A GREAT JOB IN KEEPING ME ABREAST OF MY FREE 1 YR MONITORING SERVICES. I did respond 2 my 1st 30 day results and I appreciate everything u r doing 4 me and millions or thousands of others in this important matter.I am also a victim of the newly reported T-Mobile data breach just 2 months later (20/20 Eye Care Network).I have already contacted a lawyer mentioned in 2days listing of 5 other law firms handling the T-Mobile breach. My daughter and I r both involved in this one.I just read that now AT&T also has a data breach.When r these data breaches going to end?Who knows.Take care: Carole Randi Bryon561 674 7874
